column2: >

column1: As a new innovation, we have integrated a magnetic charging connection between the back pocket and the suitcase. Imagine it like a Magsafe®, on your carry-on!
Your devices will come back to charge automatically when you lock the pocket back in.
We have beautifully integrated a removable battery inside the carry-on. You will NEVER need to remove it:
If a TSA agent ask's you about the battery, simply pull it out in seconds and show thats it's TSA approved.
To charge the battery, simply connect your USB-C laptop charger to the carry-on. Don't even open it.
And you can charge your devices .... WHEREVER YOU ARE !
KABUTO is made out of 80% recycled polycarbonate. It's so strong that your suitcase is almost unbreakable.
Security is our priority here, we have sourced the most efficient Fingerprint sensor on the market currently used on smartphones. Your suitcase will unlock in 1/100 second.
We have developed our own electronics for enhanced security, you can save up to 10 fingerprints for friends &
Thousands of customers are using the fingerprint lock on our first suitcase, and we guarantee 100% TSA compliance. We are providing a back-up key to unlock your carry-on and TSA has one as well.
You can now arrive home at 1am in silence, without waking up your family.
To design our own wheels, we simply replicated a car wheel.
Our bearings are the same used on electric skateboards. Where first priority is long and effortless spinning, these are metallic bearings and not plastic.
With our expandable system, you'll need below 10s to get 50% more volume. Great for shopping or travelling longer!
Finally, we designed a mechanical system to let you sit on your luggage, even when expanded.
The flexible fabric we have designed is similar to Kevlar, it's called Cutlon®. You cannot even cut it with a knife. Don't forget, KABUTO is almost unbreakable and has a lifetime warranty.
If you want the expandable option, please select the add-on EXPANDABLE (+$50/KABUTO)
SIZE: To design the external shell of the Kabuto, we compared all the airlines carry-on size requirements and we ended up with the most optimized size and shape.

Fingerprint lock: Only you and up to 10 people you choose can open KABUTO with their fingerprints. We also integrated a back-up key system (key furnished) for you and especially TSA. They can open your carry-on if required.
Battery: 100% of airlines allow our battery to be carried on in-flights. If you want to check-in your KABUTO, the battery is easily removable, and just take it with you in the plane.
We have shipped thousands of units of the first generation of KABUTO with 100% satisfied customers.

You are entitled to return all products  within 30 days of receiving the merchandise for full reimbursement, provided the merchandise is complete, unused and undamaged.
The products shall be returned with its original packaging, with the original labels, brand new, without having used it or washed it, wheels must not have been rolled. After 30 days, the sale is final.

We are delighted to say that we are set on our first mission trip as a married couple as we head back to Nicaragua this July. We are eager to see God work in new ways, and we can’t wait to go again and experience this mission together!  This trip is a total blessing not only to those who will be served, but also to us, as we grow deeper in our relationship with our amazing and powerful God.  We are looking to our friends, family, or even kind strangers for support!

During this trip, Jose and I will serve on the medical team, children’s ministry team, or construction team.  We pray that God will do great things in us, and through us, as we serve on whichever team He calls us to.  This Nicaragua GO Team trip is put on by New Song Foursquare Church in Kentucky.  Many churches from across the US attend this mission trip, coming together as brothers and sisters in Christ to spread the news.  Our specific team will be coming from Shorewood Foursquare Church.  We want to reach the people of Nicaragua with the Gospel in the name of Jesus.

column3: >Last year Jose and I went on a short term mission trip to Managua, Nicaragua.  During this trip, we served on our own teams, me on the Children’s Ministry Team, and him on the Medical Team.  We went into this trip wondering, “How can we change lives here?”, and although we saw that we were able to make a difference in the lives of others, the question that we didn’t ask was answered… “How will we be changed?”  I don’t think either of us were expecting this to be an area of focus.  We went on this trip to see others change...not to see us change.  But what we found totally flipped our view on what our future was meant to look like.  Before this trip, we weren’t sure when we were going to get married.  We wanted to wait until I was out of college.  We wanted to save money.  We wanted to be ready.  We had a small idea of what our future would look like and we were riding it out, just like we thought it should be.  But somewhere along the way, during our time in Nicaragua, something changed.  We found ourselves talking to each other about our desire to go on more missions, and how we both felt that this was a direction God was pushing us towards.  After much prayer we felt this was something God wanted for us.  This got us talking more seriously about marriage.  To go on mission together, we wanted to be married, which we became very excited about
column4: so excited, that no more than 6 months after coming home from Nicaragua, we were married.  We are looking forward to going on mission trips, and proclaiming our Savior’s name to the world!

column3:
>Funding is what will get us to our destination, and for that we ask your help!  This trip will cost about $1,600 each.  That’s a total of $3,200.  This trip is fast approaching and the money is due on June 15th.  Your donation to this Nicaragua fund is not only a blessing to us, but to the people of Nicaragua and the furtherment of the Gospel.

More than money, we need prayer.  Pray that God will continue to change us, and change others through us.  Pray that our relationships with Him would be strengthened.  Pray that our actions would reflect our mighty and loving God.  Pray that lives would be changed.  Pray that funds for this trip and all future trips, would not be an issue.  Pray for safety as we travel.  Pray for us to lean on God.  God has shown Himself to be so real in our lives and we cannot wait to share that feeling with the rest of the world.

Thank you for your support.  God bless!

-Jose and Marissa

And He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.”  Mark 16:15

Southern Michigan Motorsports Park will be the new destination for Mudsports in the Northern Midwest.

Small towns all over America are struggling for new industry and ways to bring business into their communities.  After holding a one day mud bog race at our annual town festival last year that was a roaring success, we learned that there are not any good facilities for these kind of events in our region.  The idea for Southern Michigan Motorsports Park was born.  Our plan is to create a professional venue that can host Mud Sport events of all types and become connected with professional organizations in Mud Sports.  We are planning to hold events in Mud drag and mud bog racing as well as tractor and truck pulls of all types.  Categories of Mud events from ATVs to Motorcycles to Big Muddin Trucks will provide a variety of interesting entertainment for people of all ages.  Our location is designed to maximize the potential for the businesses in our town as we bring crowds to see high quality Motorsports IN THE MUD!

column2: >
column3:
>What is Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding is a new way for people to raise money, awareness and support for great ideas
column4: a method of raising money through the collective effort of friends, family, customers, and individual investors. People can make a small donation or a larger contribution...there is no contribution that is too small or too large...you can just give whatever you feel is appropriate for you!
column5:
>What's our project

So now we are asking for your support to achieve one of our dreams, which will also be a project that we hope can benefit all of you, to anyone who wants a place to escape to, to relax and get away from the constant pressures of our modern world. We are looking to create a place where you can relax and unwind, that doesn't cost the earth and isn't at the cost of the Earth either. We know that most of you want a place you can go to unwind that doesn't conflict with your ideals of minimising your impact on the environment. 

We believe, as Gandhi famously said, that to change the world, we have to change as individuals. Through the practices of yoga and meditation personal transformation can take place in a gentle way, and we naturally become calmer and more accepting of ourselves and the world around us, allowing us to be more open-minded and less judgemental of ourselves and others.

I have gone through dramatic, profound changes through the practice and that's why I love to share my own experiences with others, I believe that these practices can help us to live more intelligently, healthily and happily.
column6: >What is Phase One?
column7:
/>

Phase one is to create an environmentally low impact, Self Catering Retreat Centre. Guests and Retreats leaders will be housed in 6 wooden cabins or yurts, with each cabin housing 2 single beds. A separate Kitchen cabin for group use with basic facilities for cooking and eating together. A cabin for showers, with water heated by solar water heater. And finally  a couple of environmentally sound, water saving composting toilets.

Phase One also includes the project to redesign and refurbish the pool to create an area for swimming and an area with specialist aquatic plants, waterfall and fish to clean the water naturally without the need for chemicals. And along with that, create an area around the pool for chilling and reading.
column8:
>What is Phase Two?

We have a very large barn which in the future, we would like to convert into a more permanent, all weather, all year retreat centre, with and indoor Shala, ensuite rooms and proper facilities for people with disabilities. If our goal is surpassed and we raise far more funds that we expect, all proceeds will be held, and ring-fenced, for Phase Two..but that's for a later date..back to Phase One!
column9:
>What have we done so far?

We haven't been sat around waiting for things to happen, we really want this all to work..so we've made a start!

column1: • We have bought the land (3 hectares) of tranquil, unspoilt Sardinian paradise!
• We have created an outdoor Zen space for classes, with enough space for about 10-12 people on yoga mats.
• We already have a concrete pool...it just needs a bit of TLC and conversion to a natural, chemical free pool!
• We've started groundworks, and landscaping of the land with a view to the future...

column3: >Here is a little amateur video of the Zen Outdoor Shala that we have created, just to show the kind of atmosphere we are trying to create:
>(I know, I know...it's very amateur, what can I say, I am a yoga teacher not a movie director!!)

column2:
>Why would people want to use this centre?

I already get plenty of emails each year from teachers from all over the world looking for a bespoke retreat centre for their annual getaway. The current retreat situation on Sardinia is that you can either stay at a hotel, which may or may not have an area such as a terrace or patio you can use for classes, but almost certainly won't be set up specifically or exclusively for your group to use whenever they want, or you might find a Yoga/Meditation centre that has no accommodation and therefore you have to organise accommodation at a local B&
column3:
B or hotel and then travel to the practice space separately. This tends to be a little inconvenient and often pretty costly!

We want to offer an affordable, tranquil, eco-friendly space for retreat-goers and organisers to enjoy. Sardinia is easy to get to, there are 3 airports on the island. This area of Sardinia is spectacular, we benefit from being surrounded by amazing beaches, stunning mountains, natural pools, waterfalls, amazing canyons and totally unspolit mediterranean countryside. The air here has recently been surveyed as one of the cleanest and most unpolluted air in Europe. Locally on offer from various operators you can arrange extra-curricular activities and excursions, a selection of what is on offer: Climbing, Hiking, Cycling, Kayaking, Surfing, Kite Surfing, Paddle Boarding, Boat excursions, Cave excursions, Vineyard visits, etc...
>Here is just a little sample of some of the spectacular scenery of the local area from a couple of local tourism associations:

column2:
>For retreat leaders/Organisers

We want to create a place you can hire exclusively, you will be the only group here, so there are no conflicts about what time you can do your classes, the space is bespoke and created specifically with a view to be used by groups who want a quiet, reflective space with a tranquil energy...you're not going to hear the other guests, kids and adults, screaming and splashing in the pool...this will be your space! And it won't just be for Yoga and Meditation Retreats, we foresee many other positive influence groups using the site, for example:

column1: • Holistic healing, Art Therapy, Music Therapy, Eco Therapy, Nature Therapy, Colour Therapy, etc..
• Spiritual Retreats, Women's Retreats, Men's Retreats, Detox Retreats, Vegan and/or Raw Retreats
• Cultural, Archeaological, Language, Eco Tourism, Photography Retreats

column2:
>Questions?

I think we've covered most of the information you might need, but if you have any questions we'll be happy to respond to them as soon as we can! So send us a message, ask away....

 

What are the funds for?
column3: >So what do we need the money for?

column1: • The showers, water tank, water heater and grey water filter
• Installations of water, solar water heater and electrical supplies
• The swimming pool refurbishment and consultant fees for redesign

column2:
>So why should you back this project?

Maybe you are a friend, family member or somebody who has been on retreat with me or who knows us personally or professionally and you want to support us in our project... Maybe you like to go on retreat and love the sound of what we're doing and would like to visit us in the future... Maybe you're a retreat leader, retreat organiser or you're already teaching and would like to use the retreat centre for your activities in the future...and you'd like to ""pay it forward""... Maybe you are a generous philanthropist... Maybe you're just awesome!
column3:
>Whatever your reasons, we'd like to offer something in return:

If you're a family member or a personal friend...you get to stay in our new centre at exceptional ""mates rates"" whenever there are no retreats going on! If you're not, as well as your chosen reward, you'll also get a voucher from us for a whopping 25% discount on your first booking, whether as a guest on one of our retreats or as a retreat leader.
column4:
>But what happens if we don't reach our target?...

You're kidding right, with you backing us and sharing it with everyone you know, it's never gonna happen! But if by some cruel twist of fate it all falls through, all your money will still go towards making this retreat centre come into fruition, it will be saved and ring-fenced until such time as the centre is built...

So there's nothing to lose and lots of Kudos and gratitude from us to gain!!

Contribute now by pressing the big pink ""Back it!"" button at the top of this page or by selecting one of the Perks. 

Alternatively, you can visit our website to see other ways that you can contribute.
column5:
>What else can you do to help?

Share the project, follow it, spread the word...and then share it again!! Ask friends, family and colleagues to take a look, talk to them about it over over a cup of tea, a Prosecco, on your blog, your website, on all your social networks (Facebook, Twitter etc), any occasion you get. 

The more people who see it, the more likely we are to succeed, and we can't do it without you!

Maybe you would also consider donating a bit of your time and energy organising a litte fundraising event with your family, friends, neighbours... it doesn't have to be complicated or expensive, and it can be lots of fun too!

We are sure you can come up with lots of ideas, but here are some ideas we found on the net:

column1: • Host a Home sales Party – Tupperware/Avon etc
• Activity or Skills Workshop - share your skills or hobbies with others in a mini workshop

column2:
>Become an Ambassador

We are looking for enthusiastic, community-minded individuals who are inspired about creating a better world, about creating a more peaceful harmonious future for ourselves and future generations. There is no requirement to be a yoga instructor or to be a blogger either. Just someone who likes to spread the word and has a willingness to spend some of their time talking to people online and in person. Find out more about becoming an ambassador.

About the Project Owners

We are Alex &
column3: Billy, UK expats who moved to Sardinia in 2010. We moved here to gain a slower, quieter and more sustainable way of life that what we were used to in the UK, to live in a warmer climate and to experience a new culture amongst the welcoming Sardinia people.

> 

","What is Crowdfunding?Crowdfunding is a new way for people to raise money, awareness and support for great ideas
column6: a method of raising money through the collective effort of friends, family, customers, and individual investors. People can make a small donation or a larger contribution...there is no contribution that is too small or too large...you can just give whatever you feel is appropriate for you!What's our projectSo now we are asking for your support to achieve one of our dreams, which will also be a project that we hope can benefit all of you, to anyone who wants a place to escape to, to relax and get away from the constant pressures of our modern world. We are looking to create a place where you can relax and unwind, that doesn't cost the earth and isn't at the cost of the Earth either. We know that most of you want a place you can go to unwind that doesn't conflict with your ideals of minimising your impact on the environment. We believe, as Gandhi famously said, that to change the world, we have to change as individuals. Through the practices of yoga and meditation personal transformation can take place in a gentle way, and we naturally become calmer and more accepting of ourselves and the world around us, allowing us to be more open-minded and less judgemental of ourselves and others.I have gone through dramatic, profound changes through the practice and that's why I love to share my own experiences with others, I believe that these practices can help us to live more intelligently, healthily and happily.What is Phase One? Phase one is to create an environmentally low impact, Self Catering Retreat Centre. Guests and Retreats leaders will be housed in 6 wooden cabins or yurts, with each cabin housing 2 single beds. A separate Kitchen cabin for group use with basic facilities for cooking and eating together. A cabin for showers, with water heated by solar water heater. And finally  a couple of environmentally sound, water saving composting toilets.Phase One also includes the project to redesign and refurbish the pool to create an area for swimming and an area with specialist aquatic plants, waterfall and fish to clean the water naturally without the need for chemicals. And along with that, create an area around the pool for chilling and reading.What is Phase Two?We have a very large barn which in the future, we would like to convert into a more permanent, all weather, all year retreat centre, with and indoor Shala, ensuite rooms and proper facilities for people with disabilities. If our goal is surpassed and we raise far more funds that we expect, all proceeds will be held, and ring-fenced, for Phase Two..but that's for a later date..back to Phase One!    What have we done so far?We haven't been sat around waiting for things to happen, we really want this all to work..so we've made a start!

column1: We have bought the land (3 hectares) of tranquil, unspoilt Sardinian paradise!
We have created an outdoor Zen space for classes, with enough space for about 10-12 people on yoga mats.
We already have a concrete pool...it just needs a bit of TLC and conversion to a natural, chemical free pool!
We've started groundworks, and landscaping of the land with a view to the future...
Here is a little amateur video of the Zen Outdoor Shala that we have created, just to show the kind of atmosphere we are trying to create:
(I know, I know...it's very amateur, what can I say, I am a yoga teacher not a movie director!!)

Why would people want to use this centre?I already get plenty of emails each year from teachers from all over the world looking for a bespoke retreat centre for their annual getaway. The current retreat situation on Sardinia is that you can either stay at a hotel, which may or may not have an area such as a terrace or patio you can use for classes, but almost certainly won't be set up specifically or exclusively for your group to use whenever they want, or you might find a Yoga/Meditation centre that has no accommodation and therefore you have to organise accommodation at a local B&B or hotel and then travel to the practice space separately. This tends to be a little inconvenient and often pretty costly!We want to offer an affordable, tranquil, eco-friendly space for retreat-goers and organisers to enjoy. Sardinia is easy to get to, there are 3 airports on the island. This area of Sardinia is spectacular, we benefit from being surrounded by amazing beaches, stunning mountains, natural pools, waterfalls, amazing canyons and totally unspolit mediterranean countryside. The air here has recently been surveyed as one of the cleanest and most unpolluted air in Europe. Locally on offer from various operators you can arrange extra-curricular activities and excursions, a selection of what is on offer: Climbing, Hiking, Cycling, Kayaking, Surfing, Kite Surfing, Paddle Boarding, Boat excursions, Cave excursions, Vineyard visits, etc...
Here is just a little sample of some of the spectacular scenery of the local area from a couple of local tourism associations:

For retreat leaders/OrganisersWe want to create a place you can hire exclusively, you will be the only group here, so there are no conflicts about what time you can do your classes, the space is bespoke and created specifically with a view to be used by groups who want a quiet, reflective space with a tranquil energy...you're not going to hear the other guests, kids and adults, screaming and splashing in the pool...this will be your space! And it won't just be for Yoga and Meditation Retreats, we foresee many other positive influence groups using the site, for example:
Holistic healing, Art Therapy, Music Therapy, Eco Therapy, Nature Therapy, Colour Therapy, etc..
Spiritual Retreats, Women's Retreats, Men's Retreats, Detox Retreats, Vegan and/or Raw Retreats
Cultural, Archeaological, Language, Eco Tourism, Photography Retreats

Questions?I think we've covered most of the information you might need, but if you have any questions we'll be happy to respond to them as soon as we can! So send us a message, ask away.... What are the funds for?So what do we need the money for?
The showers, water tank, water heater and grey water filter
Installations of water, solar water heater and electrical supplies
The swimming pool refurbishment and consultant fees for redesign
Create a parking area for guests

So why should you back this project?Maybe you are a friend, family member or somebody who has been on retreat with me or who knows us personally or professionally and you want to support us in our project... Maybe you like to go on retreat and love the sound of what we're doing and would like to visit us in the future... Maybe you're a retreat leader, retreat organiser or you're already teaching and would like to use the retreat centre for your activities in the future...and you'd like to ""pay it forward""... Maybe you are a generous philanthropist... Maybe you're just awesome!Whatever your reasons, we'd like to offer something in return:If you're a family member or a personal friend...you get to stay in our new centre at exceptional ""mates rates"" whenever there are no retreats going on! If you're not, as well as your chosen reward, you'll also get a voucher from us for a whopping 25% discount on your first booking, whether as a guest on one of our retreats or as a retreat leader.But what happens if we don't reach our target?...You're kidding right, with you backing us and sharing it with everyone you know, it's never gonna happen! But if by some cruel twist of fate it all falls through, all your money will still go towards making this retreat centre come into fruition, it will be saved and ring-fenced until such time as the centre is built...So there's nothing to lose and lots of Kudos and gratitude from us to gain!!Contribute now by pressing the big pink ""Back it!"" button at the top of this page or by selecting one of the Perks. Alternatively, you can visit our website to see other ways that you can contribute. What else can you do to help?Share the project, follow it, spread the word...and then share it again!! Ask friends, family and colleagues to take a look, talk to them about it over over a cup of tea, a Prosecco, on your blog, your website, on all your social networks (Facebook, Twitter etc), any occasion you get. The more people who see it, the more likely we are to succeed, and we can't do it without you!Maybe you would also consider donating a bit of your time and energy organising a litte fundraising event with your family, friends, neighbours... it doesn't have to be complicated or expensive, and it can be lots of fun too!We are sure you can come up with lots of ideas, but here are some ideas we found on the net:
Board game tournament | Video Game Tournament
Host a Home sales Party – Tupperware/Avon etc
Quiz Night | Film Night | Cards night
Sponsored event – Bike ride, walk, silence…
Activity or Skills Workshop - share your skills or hobbies with others in a mini workshop

We are two passionate Mountainboarders from Germany tirelessly waiting for a innovative and lightweight deck to appear on the market. There had been some good innovations in the past but there was always something that did not satisfy our requests. There was so much room to think outside of the box so that was exactly what we did.

After we built some decks for us, and showing them to others, more and more riders asked us to build a deck for them too.   This was the time our teamrider Joel forced us to make it available for everyone. His ambitiousness and spirited impulses gave us the motivation to go that step. He told us he never want to ride another deck anymore. With your help we can make this dream happen.

Over 2 Years of engineering, calculating, prototyping, test riding, and searching for possible producers have passed until now. It have been 2 years of ups and downs and sometimes thinking about giving up. Especially finding a reliable and still affordable producer inside Europe was a hard challenge. But there went too much private money into this project to just give up centimeters before the goal!
That´s why now is the time we ask you to take a stand and be a part of the future of our sport!

Go ahead and choose one of the  perks, and help us to make our dreams happen or/and click the BACK IT button to help us with a donation! The sport can only get better with innovations! Choose one of the Deck bundles and get the chance to be one of the first ones to get your hands on one of of these beauties for a really discounted price or choose one of the limited merch articles.
Why Haero? You are asking? Because it will change your Riding for ever!

We believe we engineered the most innovative mountainboard deck ever. As passionate longboarders and snowboarders, we tried to implement as many features as possible from those sports into our deck design.
Find out what those features are and why we think they are important for your riding!
You will get a one of a kind limited edition (50pcs.)  mountainboard deck with following benefits:

column2:
/>Concave seems to be new in mountainboarding but its not really, its more a revival!
If you look at it closely you will see that different skate decks can have different types of concaves. While testing different concaves, we found out the ""Flatcave"" is just right for us mountainboarders! The classic radial concave follows the arc of a mellow circle. The symetric ""Flatcave"" is a flat area with curved up edges. Creating a slightly more sharp edge than a radial concave. It will give you even more hold and response. Don't be afraid to ride that beast without heel straps!

/>What's that? Like on my car? Yes, almost! We designed the deck profile and the ""Flatcave"" so that they meet at a special point! Right were your big toe is! This will give you a perfect ""Gas pedal"" to steer your board with a sharp response. This will give you an immediate feedback from the truck. If you want to go around that corner really hard, just press on that ""Gas pedal"" and it will respond! There will be no delay because of missing torsional stiffness around the tip and tail or because your toe is hovering over empty space. This also works well because of the ""Power X inside"" construction we implemented. What's that? We will explain that construction in more detail below...

/>We designed the footbed of our mountainboard deck really wide to fit all footsizes. Why is that important?
Because with too narrow a board your toe movement will not directly translate to truck movement. As described above, we designed our deck to have the perfect interaction between the ""extra wide"" shape, the ""Gas pedals"" and the ""Power X inside"" (see below). If your deck is too narrow your foot travels through empty space before reaching the deck, which will cause a delayed response. That's not just inefficient but also uncomfortable. Step on a ""Wide Footbed"" deck and you'll feel way more comfortable and connected to your, deck.

column1: FLAT STAND ROCKER PROFILE
column2:
/>Every mountainboard deck currently on the market has a full camber design, which can lead to the rider's knees being over-stretched or pronationed! The natural stance of a human leg is to sit flat to the ground, that's why we designed our foot bed flat to the ground as well! That's why our boards have a mixed rocker profile with 2 ""Flat Stand"" Foot beds and a ""Camber"" between the legs.
Try yourself and you'll feel the difference!
Your meniscus will thank you...believe us!

/>Our deck's profile is a mix between the two ""Flat Stand"" foot beds and a distinct ""Camber"" between your feet.
This short Camber will give you the power and pop between your legs that you always dreamed of
column3:
)
It feels like you have a coil spring between your feet

column1: RAIL LOCK SYSTEM
column2:
/>Ever got caught up on a handrail with your chunky mountainboard wheels?
Never again with the Haero ""Rail Lock System""!
The ""Flat Stand"" and the ""Camber"" between the legs perfectly mix up to our ""Rail Lock System"". This is a point on the base of the deck where the board stops sliding diagonally before the wheels can touch the rail. So if you don't hit a rail 100% perfect, it will help you to still stick that slide!

column1: WIDE SLIDE SURFACE
column2: />The Haero deck was designed to be really wide and almost 100% flat (no concave) in the middle to get the maximum stability while sliding on rails. You will find a small raised edge in the middle of the deck to prevent the deck from hang ups and other damages. But this will not affect the predictable and comfortable yet stiff flex and pop you get out of that ""Camber"" in the middle. Read below how we managed to get a real stiff situation between tip and tail area but maintain a little softer flex between your legs!

/>When in our engineering and testing phase, we have received lots of feedback about different riders' preferences about the specs of the deck. Therefore we decided to build a ""jack of all trades"" deck which can suit every rider's needs. The Haero Deck will have 2 different stance and wheelbase options to adjust for a rider's height and weight and to adjust the wheelbase for skatepark, freeride or big air riding. 
The stance is not just up to rider's size and personal preference. With the wide stance you are as close to your trucks as on any other deck on the market, which makes it the ultimate manual machine! The wheelbase will affect the overall riding. It changes the turning radius of the deck. A short deck will have a small radius, which makes it very maneuverable e.g. in the skatepark. A long wheelbase will give you a more stable ride e.g. important on a BX track or for downhill. Also for landing big tricks and flips, a longer wheelbase can be very helpful.
We believe that we can achieve this versatility without having 2 different deck lengths. With the Haero deck, you'll get a one board quiver.

/>Now let's talk about the construction of our decks.
We believe a mountainboard should be put through its paces without compromises. Therefore durability is the most important aspect when it comes to designing a mountainboard. Thats why we decided to cover this baby as well as possible. The top of the deck will be covered with a snowboard style ""Durable Topsheet"". This helps to protect it from wild flying rocks, skateboards or scooters that may damage the fibres or the wood.

column1: EASY SLIDE BASE
column2:
/>You want to punish the base of that
mountainboard too...go ahead!
We designed our mountainboard deck to withstand all troubles with his snowboard style ""Easy Slide Base""! Dont be fooled, this is not just a snowboard base glued to a mountianboard. It's specially designed to fit our needs! It's thinner and harder to keep it light, but yet remains very durable! A normal snowboard base is too heavy and too soft for mountainboarders to use. The ""Easy Slide Base"" prevents the fibres you have on the bottom of all mountainboard decks from being destroyed by stones or handrails. Your fibres can be damaged very quickly if you're a hard rider, which the fibres to lose their strength, leading to a loss in pop, stiffness and in the end maybe also to a broken deck.
So leave your wax at home homies!
You'll be covered. 

Btw, the sliding base helps with sliding too as the name reveals. You can hit the rails with a way less entrance speed which make it really more comfortable and better for your confidence. Don't be afraid of hanging up anymore!

/>Allright, the top and base is safe, but what about the sides?
Another Feature in terms of durability are our
""ABS Sidewalls"".
In the process of testing our decks it sometimes got hit by wild flying scooters in the park or stones in the forest. Impacts like that can lead the glassfibres to break at that point and leave a gap where water can enter and destroy the woodcore or plywood. As wood is really sensitive to water, we decided to borrow another design from snowboarding. The ""ABS Sidewalls"" help to dampen the impacts which may occur and preserve the fibreglass and the woodcore.
This makes it the perfect feature for an all round protected mountainboard deck!

/>Why? Because we wanted them back!
We want to offer a clean base with no screwheads peaking through.
Dont be affraid of showcasing any screws if you're about to strech out a sweet method!

/>Let's come to the heart of
every mountainboard... the core!
Let's face the truth, mountainboards are ridiculously heavy!
This issue with deck weight remains a problem today. So what material brings the most weight to a mountainboard deck? You wont believe it, but it's the resin! If you use plywood you need to glue it together with...""drum-roll""...resin! That's weight where we don't need weight! Wood itself gives you the best strength to weight ratio.
If you don't have to cut it, don't cut it!
Even though we have a crazy shape with a camber, 30° tip and tail and a concave which goes in a totally different direction, we found a way to produce our decks with only 3 sheets of wood...and maybe even one! Let's find out with our first factory made sample decks!
We are aiming to save a minimum of 1/5 of the deck wight compared to other top range mountainboard decks currently on the market. 
If everything goes well we could even reduce the weight by 1/4

/>What else do we have inside the heart of our boards?
As explained above, we have the ""Durable Topsheet"", the ""Easy Slide Base"" and the ""ABS Sidewalls"" to cover the ""Featherlight Core"". Without fibres and resin, a deck would be very flexy, unresponsive and wobbly when it comes to torsional stiffness. The best case for a mountainboard deck is to have ZERO torsional stiffnes! Because you want to have a direct feel and feedback. If you move your leg, you want to move the truck instantaneously and not bend the deck first! Also If you ride a deck which doesn't have a stiff torsion really fast, it will give you speed woobles from hell! You also don't want that, and that's why we are bagging the ""Featherlight Core"" with ""Biaxial Fibreglass"". 
To prevent the deck from flexing too much and touching the ground while landing big jumps or drops, (and we´ve seen many decks doing just this) we need to cover it with ""unidirectional fibres"" too. 
Because fibreglass itself is really heavy, we use carbon for our next 2 features!
The ""Carbon Power Stripes"" will give the deck his progressive stiff flex pattern and helps the ""camber"" to give you a nice pop!
We want a stiff deck that is still comfortable enough to ride. You really don't want to ride a deck that is as stiff as a stone, because then your leg muscles and meniscus have to do all the work.
So what's the deal with that ""Power X inside"" now?
Check out the next box...

/>Okay, so we talked a lot about that feature before. What is the story behind it? If you use complete sheets of fibres from the tip to the tail of the deck, the flex and torional stiffness is the same everywhere on the deck. We want to have special conditions depending on the area. In our opinion, we want to have a stiff yet predictable flex between the legs and a ""stiff as possbile"" condition between our feet (the origin of power) and the truck (where the power should act)
To reach that goal, we are using 2 carbon strips layed up in an X shape to stiffen up this area. This will give the deck a good unidirectional stiffness around tip and tail and a really good torsional stiffness for a maximum direct power supply from your foot to the truck. But we can still have a predictable flex pattern between the legs.

column1: THE WEDGE SYSTEM
column2:
/>While engineering and testing our prototypes, we came up with so many specs where we firstly had to think about, how does it affect the riding if we change them. As described above, the ""Wheelbase Options"" affect the turning radius of your board. Also the truck angle is something we had to take into consideration. Again we did not want to compromise any of the specs. We want to offer you maximum adjustability! That's why we came up with the ""Wedge System"". It's nothing more than a 5° wedge which you can use to change the truck angle to
+5° or -5°.
Correct me if i am wrong, but we think the mountainboard channel trucks are working really well between a
25° and 35° deck angle.
The steeper the angle, the more turny they will get, the mellower, the more stable they will get. We would suggest to go for 25° when you want to go faster than your angel can fly or you want to land big airs and to 35° if i wanna cruise your local skatepark. If you are looking for the allroundability we would go for 30° 

All in all we believe we designed the most versatile mountainboard deck ever poduced. We wanted to open riders' minds to play around with their stance, with the wheelsbase and also the truck angle. While in the testing and prototype stage we did exactly that and experienced how big an effect that a change of a few centimeters or degrees can have on the feel of the ride! That's why we built in all those features to offer a mind openig shred tool.

column1: You still want to read more and you want to know more about the initiators and their motivation?
Check out their Interview for the International Mountainboard Association (click on the picture)
So how will the deck look like?
As we only built handmade prototypes until now, we can only show you some shots of our prototypes and some possible finishes of our producer, as well as some examples of our graphic designer.
But we promise to build a deck which is as sexy as all our features!
With 6000€ funded we will be able to produce our limited edition bro model decks!
The first batch will be limited to 50 decks. So better be fast.
With the money we want to cover:
If you help us to raise the money for our first serial production, you help us to make a change in the industry and let the sport grow into the right direction! Be the change now!
With a successful first factory made batch we want to establish on the market and work on even greater goals for the future!
• we want to be able to make our decks available for everyone beside our Indiegogo campaign. We want to distribute the decks to re sellers all around the globe
• we want to ask all riders for their feedback and engineer a even better shape and construction

• last but not least, our biggest goal would be to build a more ecological deck with the same good performance than our first batch. This is only possible if we are successful with our first state of art construction. We already have  great ideas and production methods to achieve that goal but first we need some money for the engineering
• we want to be able to engineer a shorter deck too for kids, girls or smaller persons who are looking for a high quality and lightweight deck

column1: Read what our testimonials have to say:
""This is the first deck I have ever felt comfortable without heel straps !""

""Hello guys, my Name is Giulio Bernadelli from Italy. I am a Freeride and Freestyle oriented Mountainboarder. Last year I had the opportunity to test the Haero Mountainboard deck in Freeride and on jumps. The construction is super tough and well made. My feet seats perfectly on the deck due to the concave that is there when you need it but not too big, so you still feel comfortable. Riding this deck all I can say feels stable, poppy and very light.""

""After I snaped 3 Decks Phil and me decided to develop the Haero Bro Model Decks.
Soo we made a deck exactly how we thought a MTB deck should be. And damn.. it got better than we ever wished for!
Believe me guys that's the right Deck for Jibedajas like me but also for all you downhill chargers
In Love
Sharkfin""

""It's always exciting to see something new happening in the world of mountainboarding. After meeting Phil and seeing first hand his ambitious plans for HAERO Shred Tools, I genuinely cannot wait to see this project materialise and hope to see these decks underneath riders' feet very soon. The plan is for a high spec and versatile deck that should cater to anyone's mountainboarding needs
column2: be it racing down a track, finding lines through a forest or dialing in tricks at the park. The most innovative touch is the durable top and bottom sheet, which should hugely increase the longevity of the deck and make boardslides way easier, even with small entrance speed. Leave your wax at home! With support from a community of riders, we could see this small project transpire into a progressive product.""

column1: ""I dont know how they did this, but if you stand on this deck and ride it once or twice you dont want to step on an other Deck anymore! Cant wait for this deck to hit the market!""
All of the prototypes shown in the photos and video are fully functional and tested, but details shown may change in the final product development and manufacturing

We have been testing our prototypes over 2 years now and we are still really happy with the performance of the decks. After years of testing and sourcing, a reliable manufacturing processes have been finalized. We have come to INDIEGOGO at the last stages of our product's launch which is now ready for serial production. Sure there still could be some challenges in the factory production, but our manufacturer is a well known one with many outstanding produced sports articles so we really trust them with their quality and know how! If there will be problems, we make sure to inform you as soon as possible with our method of solution!

The risks have also been minimized by the extensive prototyping and testing of our products. One risk is not being able to acquire raw materials in a timely manner to build the moulding and products themselves or the utilized capacity of our manufacturer but we feel this is a low risk because we keep him updated about the possible order and he allready have our order on hold.
Backers will be kept informed on the stages of development and when we plan to ship their board

We plan to ship your decks within august 2019. We provide worldwide shipping. Please be aware of additional customs expenses which could vary between countries. If you want to safe some money and trouble to you and us, maybe you want to choose the country Serbia in your checkout for a free pick up at the WMC World Mountainboard Championship in Novi Sad Serbia 6th-7th of September 2019 by you or some friends who attend this awesome gathering

Indiegogo do not have a feature for you to be able to add multiple perks in a single transaction. As such, if you'd like to claim multiple perks, please make a new contribution for each perk and choose Serbia as shipping country for free shipping (supposed to be for free pickup at the worldcup in Serbia 2019)
Looking for more information or have any questions? See the FAQ or write a message on info@haero.space  or insta @haeroboards or fb.com/haeroboards with your questions or concerns.
If you want to help us but cant afford a deck, back us with a virtual bro fist, a shred mug or some merchandise! Or you may just want to donate by clicking the BACK IT Button.
If that´s all too expensive, please help us with sharing our story!

We are two passionate Mountainboarders from Germany tirelessly waiting for a innovative and lightweight deck to appear on the market. There had been some good innovations in the past but there was always something that did not satisfy our requests. There was so much room to think outside of the box so that was exactly what we did.

After we built some decks for us, and showing them to others, more and more riders asked us to build a deck for them too.   This was the time our teamrider Joel forced us to make it available for everyone. His ambitiousness and spirited impulses gave us the motivation to go that step. He told us he never want to ride another deck anymore. With your help we can make this dream happen.

Over 2 Years of engineering, calculating, prototyping, test riding, and searching for possible producers have passed until now. It have been 2 years of ups and downs and sometimes thinking about giving up. Especially finding a reliable and still affordable producer inside Europe was a hard challenge. But there went too much private money into this project to just give up centimeters before the goal!
That´s why now is the time we ask you to take a stand and be a part of the future of our sport!

Go ahead and choose one of the  perks, and help us to make our dreams happen or/and click the BACK IT button to help us with a donation! The sport can only get better with innovations! Choose one of the Deck bundles and get the chance to be one of the first ones to get your hands on one of of these beauties for a really discounted price or choose one of the limited merch articles.
Why Haero? You are asking? Because it will change your Riding for ever!

We believe we engineered the most innovative mountainboard deck ever. As passionate longboarders and snowboarders, we tried to implement as many features as possible from those sports into our deck design.
Find out what those features are and why we think they are important for your riding!
You will get a one of a kind limited edition (50pcs.)  mountainboard deck with following benefits:

Concave seems to be new in mountainboarding but its not really, its more a revival!If you look at it closely you will see that different skate decks can have different types of concaves. While testing different concaves, we found out the ""Flatcave"" is just right for us mountainboarders! The classic radial concave follows the arc of a mellow circle. The symetric ""Flatcave"" is a flat area with curved up edges. Creating a slightly more sharp edge than a radial concave. It will give you even more hold and response. Don't be afraid to ride that beast without heel straps!

What's that? Like on my car? Yes, almost! We designed the deck profile and the ""Flatcave"" so that they meet at a special point! Right were your big toe is! This will give you a perfect ""Gas pedal"" to steer your board with a sharp response. This will give you an immediate feedback from the truck. If you want to go around that corner really hard, just press on that ""Gas pedal"" and it will respond! There will be no delay because of missing torsional stiffness around the tip and tail or because your toe is hovering over empty space. This also works well because of the ""Power X inside"" construction we implemented. What's that? We will explain that construction in more detail below...

WIDE FOODBEDWe designed the footbed of our mountainboard deck really wide to fit all footsizes. Why is that important?Because with too narrow a board your toe movement will not directly translate to truck movement. As described above, we designed our deck to have the perfect interaction between the ""extra wide"" shape, the ""Gas pedals"" and the ""Power X inside"" (see below). If your deck is too narrow your foot travels through empty space before reaching the deck, which will cause a delayed response. That's not just inefficient but also uncomfortable. Step on a ""Wide Footbed"" deck and you'll feel way more comfortable and connected to your, deck.

FLAT STAND ROCKER PROFILEEvery mountainboard deck currently on the market has a full camber design, which can lead to the rider's knees being over-stretched or pronationed! The natural stance of a human leg is to sit flat to the ground, that's why we designed our foot bed flat to the ground as well! That's why our boards have a mixed rocker profile with 2 ""Flat Stand"" Foot beds and a ""Camber"" between the legs.Try yourself and you'll feel the difference!Your meniscus will thank you...believe us!

COIL CAMBER Our deck's profile is a mix between the two ""Flat Stand"" foot beds and a distinct ""Camber"" between your feet.This short Camber will give you the power and pop between your legs that you always dreamed of
column2: )It feels like you have a coil spring between your feet

column1: RAIL LOCK SYSTEMEver got caught up on a handrail with your chunky mountainboard wheels?Never again with the Haero ""Rail Lock System""!The ""Flat Stand"" and the ""Camber"" between the legs perfectly mix up to our ""Rail Lock System"". This is a point on the base of the deck where the board stops sliding diagonally before the wheels can touch the rail. So if you don't hit a rail 100% perfect, it will help you to still stick that slide!

WIDE SLIDE SURFACEThe Haero deck was designed to be really wide and almost 100% flat (no concave) in the middle to get the maximum stability while sliding on rails. You will find a small raised edge in the middle of the deck to prevent the deck from hang ups and other damages. But this will not affect the predictable and comfortable yet stiff flex and pop you get out of that ""Camber"" in the middle. Read below how we managed to get a real stiff situation between tip and tail area but maintain a little softer flex between your legs!

When in our engineering and testing phase, we have received lots of feedback about different riders' preferences about the specs of the deck. Therefore we decided to build a ""jack of all trades"" deck which can suit every rider's needs. The Haero Deck will have 2 different stance and wheelbase options to adjust for a rider's height and weight and to adjust the wheelbase for skatepark, freeride or big air riding. The stance is not just up to rider's size and personal preference. With the wide stance you are as close to your trucks as on any other deck on the market, which makes it the ultimate manual machine! The wheelbase will affect the overall riding. It changes the turning radius of the deck. A short deck will have a small radius, which makes it very maneuverable e.g. in the skatepark. A long wheelbase will give you a more stable ride e.g. important on a BX track or for downhill. Also for landing big tricks and flips, a longer wheelbase can be very helpful.We believe that we can achieve this versatility without having 2 different deck lengths. With the Haero deck, you'll get a one board quiver.

DURABLE TOPSHEETNow let's talk about the construction of our decks.We believe a mountainboard should be put through its paces without compromises. Therefore durability is the most important aspect when it comes to designing a mountainboard. Thats why we decided to cover this baby as well as possible. The top of the deck will be covered with a snowboard style ""Durable Topsheet"". This helps to protect it from wild flying rocks, skateboards or scooters that may damage the fibres or the wood.

EASY SLIDE BASEYou want to punish the base of thatmountainboard too...go ahead!We designed our mountainboard deck to withstand all troubles with his snowboard style ""Easy Slide Base""! Dont be fooled, this is not just a snowboard base glued to a mountianboard. It's specially designed to fit our needs! It's thinner and harder to keep it light, but yet remains very durable! A normal snowboard base is too heavy and too soft for mountainboarders to use. The ""Easy Slide Base"" prevents the fibres you have on the bottom of all mountainboard decks from being destroyed by stones or handrails. Your fibres can be damaged very quickly if you're a hard rider, which the fibres to lose their strength, leading to a loss in pop, stiffness and in the end maybe also to a broken deck.So leave your wax at home homies!You'll be covered. Btw, the sliding base helps with sliding too as the name reveals. You can hit the rails with a way less entrance speed which make it really more comfortable and better for your confidence. Don't be afraid of hanging up anymore!

ABS SIDEWALLSAllright, the top and base is safe, but what about the sides?Another Feature in terms of durability are our""ABS Sidewalls"".In the process of testing our decks it sometimes got hit by wild flying scooters in the park or stones in the forest. Impacts like that can lead the glassfibres to break at that point and leave a gap where water can enter and destroy the woodcore or plywood. As wood is really sensitive to water, we decided to borrow another design from snowboarding. The ""ABS Sidewalls"" help to dampen the impacts which may occur and preserve the fibreglass and the woodcore.This makes it the perfect feature for an all round protected mountainboard deck!
INSERTSWhy? Because we wanted them back!We want to offer a clean base with no screwheads peaking through.Dont be affraid of showcasing any screws if you're about to strech out a sweet method!

FEATHERLIGHT CORELet's come to the heart ofevery mountainboard... the core!Let's face the truth, mountainboards are ridiculously heavy!This issue with deck weight remains a problem today. So what material brings the most weight to a mountainboard deck? You wont believe it, but it's the resin! If you use plywood you need to glue it together with...""drum-roll""...resin! That's weight where we don't need weight! Wood itself gives you the best strength to weight ratio.If you don't have to cut it, don't cut it!Even though we have a crazy shape with a camber, 30° tip and tail and a concave which goes in a totally different direction, we found a way to produce our decks with only 3 sheets of wood...and maybe even one! Let's find out with our first factory made sample decks!We are aiming to save a minimum of 1/5 of the deck wight compared to other top range mountainboard decks currently on the market. If everything goes well we could even reduce the weight by 1/4

CONSTRUCTION - OVERVIEWWhat else do we have inside the heart of our boards?As explained above, we have the ""Durable Topsheet"", the ""Easy Slide Base"" and the ""ABS Sidewalls"" to cover the ""Featherlight Core"". Without fibres and resin, a deck would be very flexy, unresponsive and wobbly when it comes to torsional stiffness. The best case for a mountainboard deck is to have ZERO torsional stiffnes! Because you want to have a direct feel and feedback. If you move your leg, you want to move the truck instantaneously and not bend the deck first! Also If you ride a deck which doesn't have a stiff torsion really fast, it will give you speed woobles from hell! You also don't want that, and that's why we are bagging the ""Featherlight Core"" with ""Biaxial Fibreglass"". To prevent the deck from flexing too much and touching the ground while landing big jumps or drops, (and we´ve seen many decks doing just this) we need to cover it with ""unidirectional fibres"" too. Because fibreglass itself is really heavy, we use carbon for our next 2 features!The ""Carbon Power Stripes"" will give the deck his progressive stiff flex pattern and helps the ""camber"" to give you a nice pop!We want a stiff deck that is still comfortable enough to ride. You really don't want to ride a deck that is as stiff as a stone, because then your leg muscles and meniscus have to do all the work.So what's the deal with that ""Power X inside"" now?Check out the next box...

Okay, so we talked a lot about that feature before. What is the story behind it? If you use complete sheets of fibres from the tip to the tail of the deck, the flex and torional stiffness is the same everywhere on the deck. We want to have special conditions depending on the area. In our opinion, we want to have a stiff yet predictable flex between the legs and a ""stiff as possbile"" condition between our feet (the origin of power) and the truck (where the power should act)To reach that goal, we are using 2 carbon strips layed up in an X shape to stiffen up this area. This will give the deck a good unidirectional stiffness around tip and tail and a really good torsional stiffness for a maximum direct power supply from your foot to the truck. But we can still have a predictable flex pattern between the legs.

THE WEDGE SYSTEMWhile engineering and testing our prototypes, we came up with so many specs where we firstly had to think about, how does it affect the riding if we change them. As described above, the ""Wheelbase Options"" affect the turning radius of your board. Also the truck angle is something we had to take into consideration. Again we did not want to compromise any of the specs. We want to offer you maximum adjustability! That's why we came up with the ""Wedge System"". It's nothing more than a 5° wedge which you can use to change the truck angle to+5° or -5°.Correct me if i am wrong, but we think the mountainboard channel trucks are working really well between a25° and 35° deck angle.The steeper the angle, the more turny they will get, the mellower, the more stable they will get. We would suggest to go for 25° when you want to go faster than your angel can fly or you want to land big airs and to 35° if i wanna cruise your local skatepark. If you are looking for the allroundability we would go for 30° All in all we believe we designed the most versatile mountainboard deck ever poduced. We wanted to open riders' minds to play around with their stance, with the wheelsbase and also the truck angle. While in the testing and prototype stage we did exactly that and experienced how big an effect that a change of a few centimeters or degrees can have on the feel of the ride! That's why we built in all those features to offer a mind openig shred tool.

So how will the deck look like?
As we only built handmade prototypes until now, we can only show you some shots of our prototypes and some possible finishes of our producer, as well as some examples of our graphic designer.
But we promise to build a deck which is as sexy as all our features!
With 6000€ funded we will be able to produce our limited edition bro model decks!
The first batch will be limited to 50 decks. So better be fast.
With the money we want to cover:
-The shipping costs of the batch & other expenses
If you help us to raise the money for our first serial production, you help us to make a change in the industry and let the sport grow into the right direction! Be the change now!
With a successful first factory made batch we want to establish on the market and work on even greater goals for the future!
we want to be able to make our decks available for everyone beside our Indiegogo campaign. We want to distribute the decks to re sellers all around the globe
we want to ask all riders for their feedback and engineer a even better shape and construction

last but not least, our biggest goal would be to build a more ecological deck with the same good performance than our first batch. This is only possible if we are successful with our first state of art construction. We already have  great ideas and production methods to achieve that goal but first we need some money for the engineering
we want to be able to engineer a shorter deck too for kids, girls or smaller persons who are looking for a high quality and lightweight deck

Hello guys, my Name is Giulio Bernadelli from Italy. I am a Freeride and Freestyle oriented Mountainboarder. Last year I had the opportunity to test the Haero Mountainboard deck in Freeride and on jumps. The construction is super tough and well made. My feet seats perfectly on the deck due to the concave that is there when you need it but not too big, so you still feel comfortable. Riding this deck all I can say feels stable, poppy and very light.""

After I snaped 3 Decks Phil and me decided to develop the Haero Bro Model Decks.Soo we made a deck exactly how we thought a MTB deck should be. And damn.. it got better than we ever wished for!Believe me guys that's the right Deck for Jibedajas like me but also for all you downhill chargersIn LoveSharkfin""

It's always exciting to see something new happening in the world of mountainboarding. After meeting Phil and seeing first hand his ambitious plans for HAERO Shred Tools, I genuinely cannot wait to see this project materialise and hope to see these decks underneath riders' feet very soon. The plan is for a high spec and versatile deck that should cater to anyone's mountainboarding needs
column2: be it racing down a track, finding lines through a forest or dialing in tricks at the park. The most innovative touch is the durable top and bottom sheet, which should hugely increase the longevity of the deck and make boardslides way easier, even with small entrance speed. Leave your wax at home! With support from a community of riders, we could see this small project transpire into a progressive product.""

column1: I dont know how they did this, but if you stand on this deck and ride it once or twice you dont want to step on an other Deck anymore! Cant wait for this deck to hit the market!""
All of the prototypes shown in the photos and video are fully functional and tested, but details shown may change in the final product development and manufacturing

We have been testing our prototypes over 2 years now and we are still really happy with the performance of the decks. After years of testing and sourcing, a reliable manufacturing processes have been finalized. We have come to INDIEGOGO at the last stages of our product's launch which is now ready for serial production. Sure there still could be some challenges in the factory production, but our manufacturer is a well known one with many outstanding produced sports articles so we really trust them with their quality and know how! If there will be problems, we make sure to inform you as soon as possible with our method of solution!

The risks have also been minimized by the extensive prototyping and testing of our products. One risk is not being able to acquire raw materials in a timely manner to build the moulding and products themselves or the utilized capacity of our manufacturer but we feel this is a low risk because we keep him updated about the possible order and he allready have our order on hold.
Backers will be kept informed on the stages of development and when we plan to ship their board

The Hideaway at Heritage Hill will serve as unique accommodations for guests who may wish to slow down and simply unplug from the modern world by experiencing Romany wagon life as it was at the turn of the century.

Additionally, the location offers a spectacular setting for group events -from traditional seminars and retreats, to a locale where artisans can share their skills and knowledge of lost trades. These latter venues will ultimately serve to support those who are keeping the traditional trades, heritage skills, and forgotten crafts of yesteryear alive for future generations.
Welcome to the Hideaway at Heritage Hill!  My name is Carol, and along with my daughter Samantha, we are creating The Hideaway at Heritage Hill.

In 2013, I traveled to Wales and lived in a Romany wagon for 2 years while I studied the art, restoration, and history of the 'travellers'.  When the time came to return to the States, it was no surprise that my baggage did not fit under the seat in front of me (2 suitcases, 1 carry-on ...and 3 wagons)!

The two years spent within these cozy hideaways on wheels taught me so much more than I can possibly communicate in just a few lines, and because of all those special moments, I am committed to restoring, saving, and sharing the beauty of wagon life.

With my daughter's expertise in marketing and project management in the tourism and hospitality industry, and my knowledge and direct experience with the restoration process, we are a dynamic partnership for success.

The Hideaway at Heritage Hill is a small business that gives guests a unique opportunity designed to evoke a romantic experience of a by-gone era.  Our three Romany wagons reside on 5 acres of wildflowers and towering pines on Whidbey Island, WA.  Each wagon site includes a 'bender tent' for added space, if desired, and for larger groups, a traditional Cheyenne Tipi will accommodate 2-6 guests.

Currently, Evergreen is in need of her topcoat enamel paint (Brunswick green) before we can place the gold-leafed carvings on the sides, front and back.  Once the carvings are secure, the decorative painting can begin.  The inside features a double bed, a writing desk, sliding windows for cross-ventilation on hot summer days, and a tiny wood burning stove that will keep you warm on the coldest of winter nights. The photo below gives you a visual of a nicely restored Bowtop wagon.

The Dolphin's namesake derives from the mythological carvings located on the front porch.  Back in the day, Showman wagons most likely travelled to county fairs and circuses.   Once inside, you will see the raised double bed in the back of the wagon, two small cushioned benches, a dresser, china hutch, and a traditional 'queenie' stove to take the chill off the evening air, and mollycroft windows for added height and moonlit nights.  Today, she will need a more uniformed, fresh topcoat of enamel to restore the wagon back to it's original state.  Below is an example of a restored Showman wagon (note the traditional continuation of color all the way from the front to the back).

For many years, this Preacher's Wagon was mistaken for a circus wagon -thus the vibrant contrasting colors!  In the late 1800's, the Church of England had commissioned less than 50 of these wagons to 'spread the word' -however, in 1914, most went to WWI and didn't return. Different from the Romany wagons, Sojourner has 2 rooms -the sitting room towards the front, and the bedroom with its doors that fully open to the outdoors.  The sitting room still has her Victorian cabinets, patterned arched glass windows, and a wood burning stove.  This extremely rare wagon now needs some structural repairs, a new roof, and a more traditional choice of paint for the topcoat in order to be restored back in harmony with its history.

When more space is needed, Stargazer, our North Cheyenne tipi can accommodate 2 to 6 guests.  In addition to our tipi, each Romany wagon will also include the use of a 'bender tent,' or belle tent (pictured below)
column2: each tent can sleep 2 people.  Comfortable mattresses are included in both the tipi and the tents.
>Your contributions, no matter how large or small,
>will make all the difference in the world to us.

column1: Our financial stumbling blocks lie in terms of materials, and outsourcing professional help for the structural restorations and fundamental infrastructural work needed to prepare the land and host guests. We've broken down our project into 2 separate phases.  This campaign is aimed to finance the costs of Phase 1 only.  If we exceed our crowdfunding goal, we will begin Phase 2 of our overall plan (described below).

column2: >All funds will go directly into these three categories:
>(a complete breakdown of costs is available by email request)

column1: Restoration materials for the Dolphin and Evergreen: body paint, brushes, decorative enamel paint, gold leafing, and mattresses.  Evergreen needs window frames, window glass, a wood stove and installation.

Infrastructure development of wagons sites and public use areas: leveling and grading the land for each site, one bath house [2 composting toilets and a shower], one covered cooking shelter, and sets of wagons stairs.

column2: ><strong>Every contribution will go to offsetting the costs above
column3: if we do not reach our goal, the project still moves forward...just painfully slow.

column1: Should we exceed our goals from phase 1, we will excitedly move forward with phase 2, which will include: the restoration of our third wagon, Sojourner (in need of the most structural work), plus, the construction of a rustic, Pacific Northwest spa
column2: complete with a wood-fired sauna, soaking tub, and an adjoining small tea house/relaxation room.

column1: While Whidbey Island is known as a fantastic destination for both tourists and locals alike, there is an extreme shortage of mid-range accommodations.  It is hard to find a place to stay for less than $125 from spring through autumn, aside from a campground. The Hideaway is trying to fill this gap. For venues and individuals alike, all of our accommodations will ultimately provide a setting that appeals to ones sense of adventure, while still offering an inner retreat, a closeness to nature, and a sense of renewal and restoration at an affordable price.

Perks are evenly split into options for both onsite and remote experiences to meet the needs of those who both plan on visiting in person, and those who can't.  However, in the spirit of collaboration, should you have another idea that might ""perk"" your interest, please let us know by emailing us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com.

Our biggest challenge so far has been to acquire workers who are knowledgeable in wagon restoration. We have resolved this issue, oddly enough, by networking with wooden boat builders.  Now it is about securing the finances to move forward with their expertise.

column2: >What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

column1: We are 100% committed to making this a reality, and we will continue moving forward piece by piece with whatever funds we do collect. With determination and a clear goal in mind, we'll continue to raise funds however necessary until our reality is a reflection of our vision.
We appreciate that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially to the campaign, but if you are reading this, you can help!
• Follow our brand new Facebook page at @HideawayAtHeritageHill.
<li>Share this campaign with everyone you can via texts, emails, socials, &amp
column2: everything else! Templates are available should you need a little help creating a message. Email us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com for our marketing template!

column1: • Organize a group donation on behalf of an organization you are part of.
• Organize a unique fundraiser, such as a popup dinner! If you are nearby, we'll be on hand to talk about our experiences and even showcase Romany recipes.
Email us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com. We will do our best to respond to all inquires within 24 hours.

Preservation.  Restoration.  Retreat.  Community Involvement.  Inspiration.

Our financial stumbling blocks lie in terms of materials, and outsourcing professional help for the structural restorations and fundamental infrastructural work needed to prepare the land and host guests. We've broken down our project into 2 separate phases.  This campaign is aimed to finance the costs of Phase 1 only.  If we exceed our crowdfunding goal, we will begin Phase 2 of our overall plan (described below).
All funds will go directly into these three categories:
(a complete breakdown of costs is available by email request)

Restoration materials for the Dolphin and Evergreen: body paint, brushes, decorative enamel paint, gold leafing, and mattresses.  Evergreen needs window frames, window glass, a wood stove and installation.

Infrastructure development of wagons sites and public use areas: leveling and grading the land for each site, one bath house [2 composting toilets and a shower], one covered cooking shelter, and sets of wagons stairs.
Every contribution will go to offsetting the costs above
column2: if we do not reach our goal, the project still moves forward...just painfully slow.

column1: Should we exceed our goals from phase 1, we will excitedly move forward with phase 2, which will include: the restoration of our third wagon, Sojourner (in need of the most structural work), plus, the construction of a rustic, Pacific Northwest spa
column2: complete with a wood-fired sauna, soaking tub, and an adjoining small tea house/relaxation room.

column1: While Whidbey Island is known as a fantastic destination for both tourists and locals alike, there is an extreme shortage of mid-range accommodations.  It is hard to find a place to stay for less than $125 from spring through autumn, aside from a campground. The Hideaway is trying to fill this gap. For venues and individuals alike, all of our accommodations will ultimately provide a setting that appeals to ones sense of adventure, while still offering an inner retreat, a closeness to nature, and a sense of renewal and restoration at an affordable price.

Perks are evenly split into options for both onsite and remote experiences to meet the needs of those who both plan on visiting in person, and those who can't.  However, in the spirit of collaboration, should you have another idea that might ""perk"" your interest, please let us know by emailing us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com.

Our biggest challenge so far has been to acquire workers who are knowledgeable in wagon restoration. We have resolved this issue, oddly enough, by networking with wooden boat builders.  Now it is about securing the finances to move forward with their expertise.
What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

We are 100% committed to making this a reality, and we will continue moving forward piece by piece with whatever funds we do collect. With determination and a clear goal in mind, we'll continue to raise funds however necessary until our reality is a reflection of our vision.
We appreciate that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially to the campaign, but if you are reading this, you can help!
Follow our brand new Facebook page at @HideawayAtHeritageHill.

Share this campaign with everyone you can via texts, emails, socials, & everything else! Templates are available should you need a little help creating a message. Email us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com for our marketing template!
Organize a group donation on behalf of an organization you are part of.
Organize a unique fundraiser, such as a popup dinner! If you are nearby, we'll be on hand to talk about our experiences and even showcase Romany recipes.
Email us at HideawayAtHeritageHill@gmail.com. We will do our best to respond to all inquires within 24 hours.

column1: As a single dad of two young children and having a love for the outdoors, camping was the natural choice when it came to the school holidays.
Unfortunately camping isn't easy when you're trying to pitch a tent, entertain two children and have fun....hence the idea for the Mi-Camp ONE was born!

The Mi-Camp ONE is the worlds 1st fully customisable inflatable camping tent. It's easy to pitch single handedly, looks the way you want, is as big as you need, and feels as comfortable as home. Its so adaptable you can even use it as a caravan or motor home awning.

The Mi-Camp ONE solves all the problems, niggles and upsets my children and I have faced whilst trying to make the most of our camping trips. From the early morning light waking us up, to staying warm at night &
column2: everything in between. We've even eliminated trip hazards for added safety.
