What is AnyWay?

AnyWay is an ""innovative step forward in the world of navigation services.""

We offer people the opportunity to be a part of a large community that will help redefine a new genre of crowd sourced data.

 AnyWay mobile app works in partnership with it's website counterpart feeding information from users into the website, exporting it into the mobile app. AnyWay is EveryWay, the application provides routes and data for cars, public transport, cyclists and pedestrians, this combined with it's minimalist look and intuitive design allows AnyOne to easily navigate.

column2: >We are a couple of university students fascinated by travelling. Hiking, cycling, driving and all forms of public transport we have been through different countries meeting new people from different cultures. We have been reliant on navigation apps and know the ins and the outs of their application in travelling.

column1: Through our journeys we have become aware of the limitations of most navigation apps out there.
""You Wouldn't believe how many times I've been lead to a dead end by online maps""
<div>Machines cannot do it all, they aren't 100% accurate and the more times we've been lost, the more times this has been clear. <span style=""background-color: initial

column2: >Particularly for hiking, routes just don't exist, at least not on navigation apps. Hiking just hasn't caught up with modern technology and heres why...

column1: Different people, different places we all have our planned routes and it's about time we share them!
Just talking, we became thinking of cool and interesting ways hiking with technology and other problems could be solved.
Now we want to share these ideas with you and hope that you will agree and back us to improve the way we travel, helping us to develop this innovative app for the community.

column9: >should be allowed to travel freely the way they want to, and this is the concept we have developed

column1: Community is key. Just like any other community we will have a connection of people working together, but online, on our maps service.

People know best, and they know the specifics. Walking around or editing our maps you are contributing, sharing your data, your directions for other people to follow. This is AnyWays primary function, interactive maps generated by the community for the community!
But, we are more than just that a map service...
Our mobile app can be used on the go! whether it’s walking, cycling, using public transport or driving we will provide you with detailed maps, delivering you swiftly to your desired location.
AnyWay is not just an A-B navigation service. Events are listed in your area, in realtime,by you! Explore the world around you, connect with new people, make traveling an experience not a chore.

column2: >Together, we can change the way we travel!

column1: We rely on your input! Our service runs on crowdsourced data, AnyOne can contribute to the maps on our website making it current, valid and personal. Upload your bands music event, promote your business, share your route.
Our biggest resource and compliment to our service is you, the user. Help us provide you with a better traveling experience by filling out our AnyWay survey and supporting us with a contribution.

column5: >Please fill out our survey to make AnyWay even better:

column4: >We welcome you to use the comment section to ask any
column16: > and to provide us with your feedback for the campaign

column1: ","What is AnyWay?AnyWay is an ""innovative step forward in the world of navigation services.""We offer people the opportunity to be a part of a large community that will help redefine a new genre of crowd sourced data. AnyWay mobile app works in partnership with it's website counterpart feeding information from users into the website, exporting it into the mobile app. AnyWay is EveryWay, the application provides routes and data for cars, public transport, cyclists and pedestrians, this combined with it's minimalist look and intuitive design allows AnyOne to easily navigate.

We are a couple of university students fascinated by travelling. Hiking, cycling, driving and all forms of public transport we have been through different countries meeting new people from different cultures. We have been reliant on navigation apps and know the ins and the outs of their application in travelling.
Through our journeys we have become aware of the limitations of most navigation apps out there.
You Wouldn't believe how many times I've been lead to a dead end by online maps""
Machines cannot do it all, they aren't 100% accurate and the more times we've been lost, the more times this has been clear. It's not the machines fault, there's just no data there.
Particularly for hiking, routes just don't exist, at least not on navigation apps. Hiking just hasn't caught up with modern technology and heres why...
Different people, different places we all have our planned routes and it's about time we share them!
Just talking, we became thinking of cool and interesting ways hiking with technology and other problems could be solved.
Now we want to share these ideas with you and hope that you will agree and back us to improve the way we travel, helping us to develop this innovative app for the community.
Hikers, Walkers, Drivers, Cyclists, Parents, Friends... you get the point.
Anyone should be allowed to travel freely the way they want to, and this is the concept we have developed AnyWay around.
Community is key. Just like any other community we will have a connection of people working together, but online, on our maps service.

People know best, and they know the specifics. Walking around or editing our maps you are contributing, sharing your data, your directions for other people to follow. This is AnyWays primary function, interactive maps generated by the community for the community!
But, we are more than just that a map service...
Our mobile app can be used on the go! whether it’s walking, cycling, using public transport or driving we will provide you with detailed maps, delivering you swiftly to your desired location.
We are current, We are you
AnyWay is not just an A-B navigation service. Events are listed in your area, in realtime,by you! Explore the world around you, connect with new people, make traveling an experience not a chore.
Together, we can change the way we travel!

We rely on your input! Our service runs on crowdsourced data, AnyOne can contribute to the maps on our website making it current, valid and personal. Upload your bands music event, promote your business, share your route.
Our biggest resource and compliment to our service is you, the user. Help us provide you with a better traveling experience by filling out our AnyWay survey and supporting us with a contribution.
Please fill out our survey to make AnyWay even better: AnyWay survey
We welcome you to use the comment section to ask any questions you may have and to provide us with your feedback for the campaign

column5:
>Why do we need Amigo? 

Unless you are still skateboarding on the same street with the same friends as you were 10, 15, 20 years ago, chances are you have travelled with your sport to venues new. Whether that is travelling to find perfect waves, new drop zones, dive spots, cliffs, yoga retreats…. Really the list can go on. But everyone has always come across the problem of trying to find someone that knows a cool local spot to go to, or a class that’s on or simply wants a new amigo to hang out with.

We found on our travels that the platform for doing this does not exist in any useful way and really wanted it! So that’s why we are so passionate about getting this project off the ground!


The Birth of Amigo

column1: is simple! We love our sports and want to find new people to share them
with!  Regardless of what sport you
do, we always know that sharing your experience with someone is better than
resonate extremely well with everything we do in our lives and this is why we are trying to create a platform that takes the ‘dating’
and ‘hook-up’ pretext out of social meet-ups. We want Amigo to be about meeting
new friends and sharing your passion!

Amigo is born as an action and adventure sports idea. So the sports we are including in our original launch are all listed below, but that doesn't have to stay that way! We believe Amigo will be a community and we want input, so if we have missed something awesome (like extreme ironing) let us know!

column2: we have taken this from a vague concept for a mobile app into

column1: something real. We have produced the logic of the app, completed the graphic
design and produced a working prototype all through personal funding and skills.  We definitely believe in
this application and that is why we have committed a good amount of our own
personal time and funds to get it off the ground, and things are looking good!
this prototype to a launch application. To do this we have already partnered
with an excellent developer that shares our vision and passion. We have laid
out a timeline that will see this app be ready to go by the end of 2015, with
the app requiring all of the back end logic, data basing and servers to be
that we receive through this campaign we will be funding the creation of the
back end of the application and taking it to a stage where we can launch it.
This requires time to fine tune the look, feel and flow of the app, prepare the
functionality so we can create light and efficient databases and organise
contributions that we obtain above the target we have set will be used to fast
track the development of this application for more platforms and to help in
launching this application through events and marketing. We have some pretty
cool ideas for this, and all contributors will get a first look and offer, but we need to keep them under wraps at this stage!
We are extremely passionate about this project, that’s pretty clear by this stage we hope! We
have been careful in making sure this thing works straight out of the gate, but
due to the nature of the application we can foresee a few challenges and have
made efforts to overcome them. Our first challenge is getting the right funding
to develop the application properly and have enough left over to test it
properly. Basically we want Amigo firing on all cylinders from the get-go. Our
next significant challenge will be gaining traction once we launch. The way the
application works, we are going to need a critical mass of users in each area
for it to be effective, so we would love any support you can give to spread the word and make the Amigo community that much more awesome!
We understand if you can't chip in financially to get this project off the ground, or if it just doesn’t happen to fit your realm. But I bet you know someone that
would love this project! We would be super appreciative of anyone that took a
few seconds to share this campaign with their friends and joined us on our social
Feel like you have some killer feedback?
Sweet, lets hear it! Send us an email at amigoapp.team@gmail.com
Lets unite to find new Amigos and share our passion!

over here and look at this crazy adventure”!  A couple of my coworkers and
I wandered over to the computer and our lives changed.  All we wanted to
do from that day on was to fly to India and drive a feeble Rickshaw 2500 km
off-road tracks, over the world's most dangerous highways, along stunning
coastal (but questionable) roads, up mountains and through a bit of jungle? I
really can’t explain it.  Maybe its a midlife crisis?  Maybe I hit my
head one too many times?  It doesn't matter because I'm going to do it.
In fact 5 of my coworker’s and friends have decided to join me on this
We have saved all our coffee money to fund this
adventure.  The only thing left to do is give it a purpose.  Some
deeper meaning!  Some spiritual cause!  Maybe just add some good
So we decided since we are going anyway, why not

gain some good Karma by doing it for charity.  With this lofty goal in mind we decided to hold out our hands and ask our friends, neighbours and any interested person for little help.  From all donations we have decided to donate to Cool Earth and the Nanaimo-Ladysmith Student Support Fund
<li>Put local people in control of at-risk rainforest
• Build better incomes, better schools, better clinics
• Do the same with the next village

The Nanaimo-Ladysmith Student Support Fund is a registered, community-based charity that helps vulnerable students by providing whatever they need to stay in school and thrive, anything from toothbrushes and shoes to bus passes and bursaries. School District 68 has a high child poverty rate:Almost 20% (1 in 5) of the student population are living in poverty. Many families struggle to provide basic necessities and so often the 'extras' such as personal hygiene products, gym shoes, school supplies, glasses etc. are not available. No child wants to attract attention by being different through obvious signs of property such as ill fitting shoes and inadequate warm clothes, dirty hair,  body odour and such. This fund enables teachers who recognize a need to provide these children with the things so many of us take for granted.
Your act of kindness can make the difference between dropping out of school or staying in and succeeding. How awesome is that!

An Homage to Dracula, a Life-Sized Terrarium--Help this Gold Rush Era Brothel, The Black Monarch Hotel, Complete Phase Two of Its Spooky Renovations!

After “one of the U.S.’s most haunted hotels” (The Metro UK) garnered international acclaim for its Victorian gothic aesthetic and serial-killer themed rooms, the owners of the Black Monarch Hotel are thrilled to reveal their ambitious Phase Two plans.
3 new themed guest rooms -  Bela Lugosi's Dracula, Jack the Ripper, &
• A new scenic foyer with a skylight that will be transformed into an atrium that feels like being inside of a terrarium
• 1.5 new bathrooms including a fully restored antique clawfoot tub
• Woodclad replica window kits + above code insulation reduce energy use 60-70%
When you donate to the Black Monarch Hotel, not only do you support a creative small business but you enrich an old mining town's tourism industry.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Please spread the word about our campaign!
• Follow the Black Monarch on Facebook or Instagram
• Book your next stay at the Black Monarch Hotel

Note for our Indian Supporters: 

This sit requires a International transitions enabled credit card only. If you are having problem with processing payments using Indian credit or debit cards, you will be able to buy the perks and make contributions at https://milaap.org/fundraisers/support-amrita-krishnaraj#

 

Each one of us is unique, and our travel stories are never the same. Travel resonates differently to every individual. Some of us would love to walk the historic cities, some might like to dive deep into the waters while some might prefer trying the local delicacies or meeting new people or even unplugging from chaotic lives to escaping in mountains ~ our little way of seeking a new adventure.

Often with our checklists, we forget that there is more to a place, the hidden gems that are undiscoverable be it an off-beat path only a local knows or a tiny restaurant which serves the best delicacies, and the local stories that you have never heard before. Did you know that the second largest dinosaur breeding sanctuary was discovered by the royal princess when she stumbled upon an egg that was known to have medicinal values? Have you ever wondered what it would be like to walk into the ancient Indus civilization’s ruined city of Lothal with an Historian showing how advanced they were 5000 years ago?

Verge believes that one can have truly memorable and novel experiences when one engages with a local, learning about their culture or heritage, hearing their stories and even trying some of their artforms and traditions. There is always something new to be discovered at a place. Our team at Verge is working with passionate hosts and stalwarts on creating experiences that lets you uncover a city by diving into the true local. 

We've got you covered! Whatever excites you! 

From local dishes, to history walks, to rafting in the white water, to gazing at the meteor showers, to discovering yourself with yoga, to being fascinated with ancient folktales, to a lot more out there to be uncovered. Each of our experiences is curated, hyper-local and truly authentic that has been vetted by our team as you deserve the best.

Why let going to a place stop you from any adventure when you can enjoy the thrill of new experiences from the comfort of your homes. You could sit on your couch, and indulge in age-old traditional yoga with a tantric guru from Kerala, or interact with a freedom fighter from India listening to the stories of non-violence. Verge has tons of unique and authentic virtual experiences that lets you relish traditions and culture from far off places. Nothing should stop you from making memorable memories and discovering something new!

Where can I find these one-of-a-kind experiences? 

Simple! The Verge app makes it easy for you to connect with anything local. All of the curated and hyper-local experiences will be available at the click of your finger tip through our app. On downloading the app, all in-destination and virtual experiences are a click away. The app is designed for you, gives you myriad experiences and also identifies and recommends experiences that you would love. 

And that's not all! Verge understands that some of your favorite memories have always been with the people you love. Through the app you will be able to create groups with your loved ones, and pick experiences to enjoy together. Not sure what your friends might like? No worries! Just add them to your group and the app will recommend some of the best experiences for your groups based on each member's preference. Try the experiences together, discover something new and rekindle the bond! 

 

Where are we headed to?

 

We are just starting on a long journey to opening a window to the world of experiences and travel. Our efforts would require immense support from each of you. The initial goal we intend to raise will help with the development of the personalized app and website. Further, this amount will aid us in identifying, training and supporting our local hosts. This initial investment will also be used in growing our customer base.

We would love our software to be agile, user friendly, immersive and an absolute pleasure to use for both our customers and hosts. Thus a part of the amount raised as stretch goal 1 will go towards implementation of full-stack systems to connect our hosts and customers. And the remaining of the amount will be used for content generation for our hosts. 

Imagine getting a surprise in a small package from the place of your experience? Wouldn’t that make your day? The stretch goal 2 would help us ship our local ingredients and delightful gifts to our customers.

We appreciate each of you who helped us achieve our goals. Here’s how we make it up to you!  

Once we reach the stretch goal 1, an experience on the ancient sculptures, scripts and languages will be made available at 60% of the price to all our earlier supporters. This experience will give you a sneak peek into the culture and society of one of the oldest civilizations.  

And the experience of a lifetime awaits for all supporters at stretch goal 2! You will be able to experience some of the world’s oldest folklore that belongs to the Tamil culture.

 

What's in it for you?

You are one of the few people who gets early access to some of our curated, one-of-a-kind virtual experiences handpicked by our team. We have assorted experiences ranging from cooking local dishes to exploring the world of yoga. As you enjoy these virtual experiences and take a quick dip into the culture of India, walk down the ancient and awe-inspiring multi-faceted traditions that have manifested into guiding principles of modern Indian society.

Perk 1: Recipes &
column2:
Traditions with a Native (Virtual)

Immerse yourself in a world of spices and cook some of the most authentic and delicious family recipes that the host (our culinary tradition) has to offer! You will experience the transformative power of spices &
column3:
learn to add them to your life in amazing ways. While you are cooking hear more about Indian tradition and how each recipe in this experience resonates with it.

 

Perk 2: Discover yourself: Tantric way (Virtual)

Explore the world of traditional yoga with a guru who will introduce you to an ancient practice of Tantra Yoga that lets you get as deep an understanding of yourself as possible and attaining bliss. Learn how mantras and mudras (gestures) can help with achieving a state of peace.

 

Perk 3: Kalari: Ancient War Techniques (Virtual)

Experience Kalari, one of the oldest surviving Indian war form with a traditional master, a six times champion. Originally designed for the battlefield, Kalari is a dynamic art and helps gain awareness and mental stability during chaos. Understand the spiritual and wellness aspects of Kalari and master a few moves to benefit daily life.

 

Perk 4: Wine &
column4:
Chocolates: Indian way (Virtual)

 

This bean to bar chocolate experience has a spicy Indian twist. Enjoy a quick tour of the chocolate process and learn to flavor up your chocolates with traditional Indian spices from a renowned chocolate maker. Get quick tips on chocolate tasting and have a fun and intellectual experience sipping wine and lavishing on the chocolates with your loved one.

Making chocolates and sipping wine becomes more fun when you share it with a loved one. Bring a friend or loved one and get more discount.

 

When can I enjoy the experiences? 

We know that you are excited and looking forward to exploring these authentic experiences from India. There is not long to wait. Once you have purchased the perks, you will receive an email from the Verge team requesting you to pick a date and time when you would like to try these experiences. If you would like to do these experiences with your bunch of people who have also bought the perks, we can accommodate that, just shoot us an email at info@experienceverge.com. The experience timing will be finalized based on your preference and the hosts availability. We will start delivering the experiences from the last week of April on a first come first serve basis. All experiences will be delivered by the mid of June. So be patient and have fun!

 

Meet the Crazy Ones:

We are, Amrita and Rutvi, and we met at Johns Hopkins and became friends because of our shared love for travel. Both of us are travel freaks, but prefer different travel experiences. Amrita is ready to jump out of the plane for skydiving or would drive hours for the perfect food while Rutvi would walk inside the museum for hours or go through every new flavor on the bar. Apart from travel, we also love dissecting ideas, working on creating business cases and solving problems. With Amrita, having an ardent love for Tech, and Rutvi having a keen passion for Business, we are headstrong and would never sit idle if we know there was a better way to do things. Having spent hours finding the local dishes, finding that point with a beautiful view, finding the history behind the building or getting any authentic experience at a place, we understand that it's not easy and often felt  as if we were just crossing off the items on the checklist during travel. We have wrecked our brains and finally wanted to do more than just searching for hours. We are working on this platform that can actually find the right local experience for you. 

After months of customer and market research, we moved on to researching and finding some of these experiences. India being one of the most diverse countries with a lot of hidden gems piqued our interest and as we did more research, we were pleasantly surprised by the integration of ancient principles and traditions into the modern living. Thus are bringing form India the hyperlocal and authentic experiences. Join us in discovering a new experiences and the journey forward.

 

How else can I help?

We really appreciate each of you who have taken time to check out our campaign! Some of you might have already donated or tried our perks and others might not be able to contribute at this point. Either ways, there are ways you can help this campaign become a huge success.

1. Follow us on social media platforms Facebook, Instagram, Twitter link, Linked In. Like, comment, share, and retweet as many of our posts as you can. Share pictures or videos of your favorite local places, food or activities, and tag us at @experience_verge and use the hashtag #experienceverge.

2.    Help us spread the word about this campaign by posting or messaging your friends.

 

 

","Note for our Indian Supporters: This sit requires a International transitions enabled credit card only. If you are having problem with processing payments using Indian credit or debit cards, you will be able to buy the perks and make contributions at https://milaap.org/fundraisers/support-amrita-krishnaraj# Each one of us is unique, and our travel stories are never the same. Travel resonates differently to every individual. Some of us would love to walk the historic cities, some might like to dive deep into the waters while some might prefer trying the local delicacies or meeting new people or even unplugging from chaotic lives to escaping in mountains ~ our little way of seeking a new adventure.Often with our checklists, we forget that there is more to a place, the hidden gems that are undiscoverable be it an off-beat path only a local knows or a tiny restaurant which serves the best delicacies, and the local stories that you have never heard before. Did you know that the second largest dinosaur breeding sanctuary was discovered by the royal princess when she stumbled upon an egg that was known to have medicinal values? Have you ever wondered what it would be like to walk into the ancient Indus civilization’s ruined city of Lothal with an Historian showing how advanced they were 5000 years ago?Verge believes that one can have truly memorable and novel experiences when one engages with a local, learning about their culture or heritage, hearing their stories and even trying some of their artforms and traditions. There is always something new to be discovered at a place. Our team at Verge is working with passionate hosts and stalwarts on creating experiences that lets you uncover a city by diving into the true local. We've got you covered! Whatever excites you! From local dishes, to history walks, to rafting in the white water, to gazing at the meteor showers, to discovering yourself with yoga, to being fascinated with ancient folktales, to a lot more out there to be uncovered. Each of our experiences is curated, hyper-local and truly authentic that has been vetted by our team as you deserve the best.Why let going to a place stop you from any adventure when you can enjoy the thrill of new experiences from the comfort of your homes. You could sit on your couch, and indulge in age-old traditional yoga with a tantric guru from Kerala, or interact with a freedom fighter from India listening to the stories of non-violence. Verge has tons of unique and authentic virtual experiences that lets you relish traditions and culture from far off places. Nothing should stop you from making memorable memories and discovering something new!

column1: Where can I find these one-of-a-kind experiences? Simple! The Verge app makes it easy for you to connect with anything local. All of the curated and hyper-local experiences will be available at the click of your finger tip through our app. On downloading the app, all in-destination and virtual experiences are a click away. The app is designed for you, gives you myriad experiences and also identifies and recommends experiences that you would love. And that's not all! Verge understands that some of your favorite memories have always been with the people you love. Through the app you will be able to create groups with your loved ones, and pick experiences to enjoy together. Not sure what your friends might like? No worries! Just add them to your group and the app will recommend some of the best experiences for your groups based on each member's preference. Try the experiences together, discover something new and rekindle the bond!  Where are we headed to? We are just starting on a long journey to opening a window to the world of experiences and travel. Our efforts would require immense support from each of you. The initial goal we intend to raise will help with the development of the personalized app and website. Further, this amount will aid us in identifying, training and supporting our local hosts. This initial investment will also be used in growing our customer base.We would love our software to be agile, user friendly, immersive and an absolute pleasure to use for both our customers and hosts. Thus a part of the amount raised as stretch goal 1 will go towards implementation of full-stack systems to connect our hosts and customers. And the remaining of the amount will be used for content generation for our hosts. Imagine getting a surprise in a small package from the place of your experience? Wouldn’t that make your day? The stretch goal 2 would help us ship our local ingredients and delightful gifts to our customers.We appreciate each of you who helped us achieve our goals. Here’s how we make it up to you!  Once we reach the stretch goal 1, an experience on the ancient sculptures, scripts and languages will be made available at 60% of the price to all our earlier supporters. This experience will give you a sneak peek into the culture and society of one of the oldest civilizations.  And the experience of a lifetime awaits for all supporters at stretch goal 2! You will be able to experience some of the world’s oldest folklore that belongs to the Tamil culture. What's in it for you?You are one of the few people who gets early access to some of our curated, one-of-a-kind virtual experiences handpicked by our team. We have assorted experiences ranging from cooking local dishes to exploring the world of yoga. As you enjoy these virtual experiences and take a quick dip into the culture of India, walk down the ancient and awe-inspiring multi-faceted traditions that have manifested into guiding principles of modern Indian society.Perk 1: Recipes & Traditions with a Native (Virtual)Immerse yourself in a world of spices and cook some of the most authentic and delicious family recipes that the host (our culinary tradition) has to offer! You will experience the transformative power of spices & learn to add them to your life in amazing ways. While you are cooking hear more about Indian tradition and how each recipe in this experience resonates with it. Perk 2: Discover yourself: Tantric way (Virtual)Explore the world of traditional yoga with a guru who will introduce you to an ancient practice of Tantra Yoga that lets you get as deep an understanding of yourself as possible and attaining bliss. Learn how mantras and mudras (gestures) can help with achieving a state of peace. Perk 3: Kalari: Ancient War Techniques (Virtual)Experience Kalari, one of the oldest surviving Indian war form with a traditional master, a six times champion. Originally designed for the battlefield, Kalari is a dynamic art and helps gain awareness and mental stability during chaos. Understand the spiritual and wellness aspects of Kalari and master a few moves to benefit daily life. Perk 4: Wine & Chocolates: Indian way (Virtual) This bean to bar chocolate experience has a spicy Indian twist. Enjoy a quick tour of the chocolate process and learn to flavor up your chocolates with traditional Indian spices from a renowned chocolate maker. Get quick tips on chocolate tasting and have a fun and intellectual experience sipping wine and lavishing on the chocolates with your loved one.Making chocolates and sipping wine becomes more fun when you share it with a loved one. Bring a friend or loved one and get more discount. When can I enjoy the experiences? We know that you are excited and looking forward to exploring these authentic experiences from India. There is not long to wait. Once you have purchased the perks, you will receive an email from the Verge team requesting you to pick a date and time when you would like to try these experiences. If you would like to do these experiences with your bunch of people who have also bought the perks, we can accommodate that, just shoot us an email at info@experienceverge.com. The experience timing will be finalized based on your preference and the hosts availability. We will start delivering the experiences from the last week of April on a first come first serve basis. All experiences will be delivered by the mid of June. So be patient and have fun! Meet the Crazy Ones:We are, Amrita and Rutvi, and we met at Johns Hopkins and became friends because of our shared love for travel. Both of us are travel freaks, but prefer different travel experiences. Amrita is ready to jump out of the plane for skydiving or would drive hours for the perfect food while Rutvi would walk inside the museum for hours or go through every new flavor on the bar. Apart from travel, we also love dissecting ideas, working on creating business cases and solving problems. With Amrita, having an ardent love for Tech, and Rutvi having a keen passion for Business, we are headstrong and would never sit idle if we know there was a better way to do things. Having spent hours finding the local dishes, finding that point with a beautiful view, finding the history behind the building or getting any authentic experience at a place, we understand that it's not easy and often felt  as if we were just crossing off the items on the checklist during travel. We have wrecked our brains and finally wanted to do more than just searching for hours. We are working on this platform that can actually find the right local experience for you. After months of customer and market research, we moved on to researching and finding some of these experiences. India being one of the most diverse countries with a lot of hidden gems piqued our interest and as we did more research, we were pleasantly surprised by the integration of ancient principles and traditions into the modern living. Thus are bringing form India the hyperlocal and authentic experiences. Join us in discovering a new experiences and the journey forward. How else can I help?We really appreciate each of you who have taken time to check out our campaign! Some of you might have already donated or tried our perks and others might not be able to contribute at this point. Either ways, there are ways you can help this campaign become a huge success.1. Follow us on social media platforms Facebook, Instagram, Twitter link, Linked In. Like, comment, share, and retweet as many of our posts as you can. Share pictures or videos of your favorite local places, food or activities, and tag us at @experience_verge and use the hashtag #experienceverge.2.    Help us spread the word about this campaign by posting or messaging your friends.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: Copyright 2017-20189 Functional Tonic Designs LLC Randy Blevins",15.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Jason Compton and I am the founder and CEO of Snake Snap.  The idea of Snake Snap came about 3 years ago when we had a snake in our pool.  Being from Florida snakes were actually my biggest fear and I did not know how to detect a single one.  I have two young children and I thought to myself what if we could take a picture of this snake and know immediately what it was so that I could help educate my children as I was ignorant on the topic.  I started to research what that snake was and found out it was a harmless Ringneck snake and is commonly found in swimming pools to get a drink of water but is too tiny to get out.  I thought how sad and at that moment Snake Snap was born.  As I studied I quickly learned that detecting snakes was not that difficult and through the process my fear wall started to come down and I began to appreciate snakes, their beauty and what their purpose is in our ecosystem.  By learning how to detect,  also what they eat and where they hide I became enamored with it.  I was a financial advisor for 17 years and it was great but I felt as though I stumbled upon my passion in life which is to educate and help make a difference in this world.  Never fathomed that would come from the animal I was deathly afraid of.  I saw an opportunity to create change by educating and build a business on a global level since snakes are on almost every piece of land on the planet and is also one of the most feared and misunderstood creatures in the wild.  I do not have a technology background but was able to find a development company and also meet some very key people in the herpetology industry that believed in me and my project.  I launched the app in June of 2019 and since that time we have over 105,000 downloads and submissions from every state in the US and over 180 different countries.  We currently get over 600 downloads a day and growing rapidly.  This has been a self funded endeavor and I have spent every penny I ever saved on this.  I have a team of 15 people that volunteer and help identify manually until we can get the funding for automation and are able to scale our business.  This has grown organically and we have changed over 50,000 peoples view of snakes and their importance while also saving just as many snakes from being killed.  We need funding to implement the artificial intelligence to take the load off of manually identifying, pay and grow my ID team and have marketing funds to spread the word globally.  We also have game ideas that will be inside the app and unique ways to educate in a simple manner.  In exchange for your contribution we have merchandise and will also refund any in app upgrades or future costs associated with our App.  We are about to release our updated website with every snake in the nation and connections to removal services and organizations in other countries we have partnered with that have information on snakes specific to their country.

column4: >Nepal needs all the help to keep getting better after the

column1: earthquake and other obstacles! Nepal needs tourism to keep being
Tourism will help Nepal’s financial recovery by creating jobs
and services, which will improve quality of life in Nepal and support local

column4:
/>

People of Nepal are still struggling to meet their basic needs for a

column1: solid home, access to good hygiene, medical services and affordable education. In
2015 Nepal was facing a lot of hardship. In April and May, the devastating
earthquake and subsequent after-shakes were shifting the ground underneath the
feet of millions of poor Nepalis, killing more than 8,000 lives and reducing
homes to debris. When it already seemed that the country could get back on the
horse and ride towards a better future, a life-crippling blockade at the
India-Nepal border was imposed on Nepali population. This blockade had resulted
from political disputes following promulgation of a new Nepali constitution in
September 2015, and left the locals without supplies of gas, fuel, medicines,
making prices of essential items soar and black market thrive. This political
matter has now been settled, and Nepal can rise and march on again- yet, the
country needs financial incentives, opportunities to grow and to show its
Nepal boasts indescribable natural beauty. Hills upon hills of
unspoiled countryside sprinkled with colorful clay-house villages, mountain
peaks covered in eternal snow on the horizon, including 8 out of the world’s 14
summits of above 8,000m altitude. Wild rivers are winding through the valleys,
all this varied landscape adorned by precious flora and fauna. Adventure lovers
can indulge in trekking, river rafting, paragliding and bungee jumping at some
of the most spectacular locations of this planet. Nature lovers can admire rare
species of birds and flowers. Spiritual as well as peace seekers will find
themselves on a path to self-discovery and in deep introspection during
religious rituals and meditation at numerous temples, shrines and retreat and
yoga centers. Sport, nature, retreating from the chaos and fuss of our world,
whichever your interest, you will be amazed at the possibilities Nepal has to
offer. Above all, though, the unrivaled friendliness and warmth of Nepali
people you will meet will stay with you in your heart long after your Nepal
What is the impact of earthquake on Nepal?
Nepal has three main religions: Hinduism, Buddhism and tourism. Tourism
and the remuneration coming from Nepali workers abroad, particularly in the
Gulf states, are the two major contributors to Nepal's economy.
to the Finance Ministry of Nepal, tourist arrivals plunged 46 percent in 2015
as a series of disasters (earthquake and blockade) pounded Nepal’s tourism
According to a report prepared by the ministry, Nepal lost
352,330 tourists during the review period of 10 months, hitting foreign
exchange earnings and jobs in the industry hard. The country received 300,325
foreign visitors by air until October 2015, down from 652,655 in the same
The worst effect has been witnessed with employment in the
tourism industry. The ministry said that jobs in the country’s tourism sector
had gone down by 25 percent due to the series of misfortunes. The Finance
Ministry report said that employment in hotels and restaurants had gone down by
This has had a serious impact on the quality of life of Nepali people. People
are forced to either struggle or leave their country in search of alternatives.
More than 4 million Nepalis are living abroad due to lack of opportunity in
Nepal to fulfill their basic needs.
Your visit will help Nepal recover from this crisis. Every
dollar you spend on accommodation, food and activities will support local
businesses and create thousands of job opportunities. This will improve quality

of life of people in Nepal and help them stay with their family. 


What is Access Helpline?

Nepal lacks a proper information resource platform. Therefore,
it may be difficult for tourists to find the desired products
and services. Businesses in Nepal also struggle in promoting their products,
services, offers and activities, as reaching out to travelers has not been
helpline promises to deliver easy access to information and
help promote local businesses through our website, mobile app, 24x7 helpline
Information about businesses, services and places of interest will
be digitized and made publicly available through VibesNepal.com.
Local businesses will gain more visibility. Travelers and locals will be able
to learn more about what is available and access services more easily.
Access Helpline mobile app will enable travellers to chat live and/
or make calls from their smart phone anytime and anywhere. The mobile app
will also introduce other attractive features, making your search for services
24x7 helpline will answer queries from travellers and/or provide
access to critical services (medical, visa, embassy services etc.) in case of
Travellers will also be able to visit information desks and
resolve their queries or problems. We are planning to set up 2 information
desks in the heart of the Kathmandu tourist district (Thamel).
How will Nepal benefit from our campaign?
With our campaign we wish to encourage people all around the
world to make Nepal their travel destination. The fund raised from the campaign
will also help launching Access Helpline, which will directly benefit Nepal by:
marketing, administration and management to 120+ Nepalis within 2 months
during their stay in Nepal by providing easy access to
products and services. Access Helpline is aiming to promote more than
Access Helpline is a project of passion created by a team of
individuals who have the best interest in supporting Nepal. We wish to give
hope and to set an example by offering job opportunities to socially marginalised
groups, therefore 20% of roles in Access Helpline will be given to people with
Access Helpline will also spend 25% of its profit on projects
related with youth empowerment (professional and personal skill-building
trainings) and community development (supporting connection, communication
We believe our project will contribute to helping Nepal rise
again, in a more sustainable way.

1) Give a gift of your choice ($10-$75) OR 

2) Make Nepal your travel destination for 2016 and
column4:
>buy one of our travel packages   

(profit made from sales of each package will be used to fund this campaign)

     a. Make a $100 trip
     b. Travel light ($500)
     c. Explore Nepal ($1000)

      OR

3) Contribute what you can AND

share our campaign. Help us spread the words!


Portfolio of members

column9: > Tanka Ram Poudel - Business Strategy, Project Planning

column1: I have been working in the field of IT since 2001 on system, network, web and mobile platform. Since 2005, I have been running my own business in training and consultation sector.

The earthquake of 25th April 2015 caused a very negative impact on business as with the country as a whole. Specially the blockade was unbearable. This situation forced me in thinking about working on strengthening the platform as it seems obvious that Nepal didn't have a sustainable economic platform. I spent my time connecting with organizations and likeminded individuals on discussion on how the dream of a sustainable Nepal can be achieved.

On 25th of December 2015, I met with Shiva K Shrestha and we connected instantly and started working together on realizing our common dream. Meeting with Myrthe and Linda added more strength to our plan and we formed a long term strategy for supporting Nepal's economy through entrepreneurship development.

We teamed up to form Access Helpline, which will work as a support platform for locals and travelers and provide easy access to information and services and at the same time provide local businesses an opportunity to reach out to their audience.
I'm a Dutch woman who came to Nepal on 2015 January as a speech therapist and  fell in love with the country and the people. When the earthquake on 25th of April 2015 happened I was back in

Holland and my heart told me to come back and help as much as possible. I found Bring thoughts to Action flyer in a restaurant and got interested instantly. I got more connected and got in charge of different
projects. In the end of 2015 I went back to Holland due to my visa situation but came back in 2016 due to love for Nepal and her people.
When I got back I realized that there are already more
than 50,000 NGO in Nepal so my focus shifted more towards bringing out sustainable solutions which can improve quality of life in Nepal and increase job opportunities.
Through brainstorming sessions, I connected with likeminded people and we
started working on Access Helpline. I believe this is a feasible, practical and
necessary solution which will improve the image of Nepal to the world and provide a better experience to the travelers and locals.
I'm a Danish woman who came to Nepal as a traveler and
fell in love with the country and the people. Two days after surviving the
devastating earthquake on 25th of April 2016, Shiva K Shrestha and I started the

In the end of 2015 I had to go back to my home country due to visa situation. After months of relief work and volunteering, I realized that there is a lot to be done for Nepal and Nepalese people to become self sufficient. I came back to Nepal in 2016 with the sole purpose of helping individuals and organizations work towards sustainable solutions. I teamed up with group of likeminded people and started working on concept of Access Helpline, which promises to create job opportunities for hundreds of Nepalese and at the same time supports tourism and local businesses.
Being one of the core members of Access Helpline gives
me the hope and passion to find the most beneficial solution to build up a
society where we support each other.
Two days after surviving the devastating earthquake
25th of April 2016, Linda Ravn Olsen and I started the NGO Bring Thoughts to
Being a Nepali I feel strongly responsible for being an example for my own
Nation. We can make a different by building up platforms where people can
connect and collaborate. Nepal need to be sustained by improving the financial
situation through jobs. More than 4 million Nepalese are already working abroad to
sustain their families. I believe we can create it here. Nepal have so much potential
through local resource and services to give.  (Founder of Hostel Fireflies and Kathmandu Eco Hostel).
VibesNepal.com is an online platform which connects businesses to audiences. As an event, entertainment and business promotion platform, it caters social media promotion and branding services.

Getwise Network is an IT service company focused on developing and providing services which will ensure effective operation or enhance efficiency. GWN works as a technology consultant for multiple organizations in handling server, network and web related problems.

Fireflieshub.com is an online platform which provides travel and tour services to locals and travelers. Our primary focus is to promote home-stays and eco hostel programs. We believe in providing authentic Nepal experience to our clients.
Based on the amount of fund being raised we have the following strategy for utilisation.
Start operation in Kathmandu Valley in first year. Provide job to 120 employees.
Start operation in 4 major cities of Nepal (Kathmandu, Pokhara, Chitwan, Biratnagar, Lumbini) in first year. Provide job to 240 employees.
Start operation in 10 major cities of Nepal  in first year. Provide job to 480 employees.
Funds exceeding $100,000 will be provided to non-profit organization for projects related with youth empowerment and community development.
Please visit our website www.accesshelpline.com or
contact us at accesshelplinenepal@gmail.com

We believe our project will contribute to helping Nepal rise
again, in a more sustainable way.
You can help us accomplish it!

1) Give a gift of your choice ($10-$75) OR 2) Make Nepal your travel destination for 2016 and buy one of our travel packages   (profit made from sales of each package will be used to fund this campaign)     a. Make a $100 trip     b. Travel light ($500)     c. Explore Nepal ($1000)      OR3) Contribute what you can AND
share our campaign. Help us spread the words!Portfolio of members
Tanka Ram Poudel - Business Strategy, Project Planning
I have been working in the field of IT since 2001 on system, network, web and mobile platform. Since 2005, I have been running my own business in training and consultation sector.

The earthquake of 25th April 2015 caused a very negative impact on business as with the country as a whole. Specially the blockade was unbearable. This situation forced me in thinking about working on strengthening the platform as it seems obvious that Nepal didn't have a sustainable economic platform. I spent my time connecting with organizations and likeminded individuals on discussion on how the dream of a sustainable Nepal can be achieved.

On 25th of December 2015, I met with Shiva K Shrestha and we connected instantly and started working together on realizing our common dream. Meeting with Myrthe and Linda added more strength to our plan and we formed a long term strategy for supporting Nepal's economy through entrepreneurship development.

We teamed up to form Access Helpline, which will work as a support platform for locals and travelers and provide easy access to information and services and at the same time provide local businesses an opportunity to reach out to their audience.
Myrthe Bakels - Human Resource and Marketing
I'm a Dutch woman who came to Nepal on 2015 January as a speech therapist and  fell in love with the country and the people. When the earthquake on 25th of April 2015 happened I was back in

Holland and my heart told me to come back and help as much as possible. I found Bring thoughts to Action flyer in a restaurant and got interested instantly. I got more connected and got in charge of different
projects. In the end of 2015 I went back to Holland due to my visa situation but came back in 2016 due to love for Nepal and her people.
When I got back I realized that there are already more
than 50,000 NGO in Nepal so my focus shifted more towards bringing out sustainable solutions which can improve quality of life in Nepal and increase job opportunities.
Through brainstorming sessions, I connected with likeminded people and we
started working on Access Helpline. I believe this is a feasible, practical and
necessary solution which will improve the image of Nepal to the world and provide a better experience to the travelers and locals.
I'm a Danish woman who came to Nepal as a traveler and
fell in love with the country and the people. Two days after surviving the
devastating earthquake on 25th of April 2016, Shiva K Shrestha and I started the

In the end of 2015 I had to go back to my home country due to visa situation. After months of relief work and volunteering, I realized that there is a lot to be done for Nepal and Nepalese people to become self sufficient. I came back to Nepal in 2016 with the sole purpose of helping individuals and organizations work towards sustainable solutions. I teamed up with group of likeminded people and started working on concept of Access Helpline, which promises to create job opportunities for hundreds of Nepalese and at the same time supports tourism and local businesses.
Being one of the core members of Access Helpline gives
me the hope and passion to find the most beneficial solution to build up a
society where we support each other.
Two days after surviving the devastating earthquake
25th of April 2016, Linda Ravn Olsen and I started the NGO Bring Thoughts to
Being a Nepali I feel strongly responsible for being an example for my own
Nation. We can make a different by building up platforms where people can
connect and collaborate. Nepal need to be sustained by improving the financial
situation through jobs. More than 4 million Nepalese are already working abroad to
sustain their families. I believe we can create it here. Nepal have so much potential
through local resource and services to give.  (Founder of Hostel Fireflies and Kathmandu Eco Hostel).
VibesNepal.com is an online platform which connects businesses to audiences. As an event, entertainment and business promotion platform, it caters social media promotion and branding services.

Getwise Network is an IT service company focused on developing and providing services which will ensure effective operation or enhance efficiency. GWN works as a technology consultant for multiple organizations in handling server, network and web related problems.

Fireflieshub.com is an online platform which provides travel and tour services to locals and travelers. Our primary focus is to promote home-stays and eco hostel programs. We believe in providing authentic Nepal experience to our clients.
Based on the amount of fund being raised we have the following strategy for utilisation.
Start operation in Kathmandu Valley in first year. Provide job to 120 employees.
Start operation in 4 major cities of Nepal (Kathmandu, Pokhara, Chitwan, Biratnagar, Lumbini) in first year. Provide job to 240 employees.
Start operation in 10 major cities of Nepal  in first year. Provide job to 480 employees.
Funds exceeding $100,000 will be provided to non-profit organization for projects related with youth empowerment and community development.
Please visit our website www.accesshelpline.com or

Protecting people and sharks with non-lethal tech
 

Ocean Guardian, Powered by Shark Shield Technology, are the world leaders in electrical shark deterrent technology. In fact, we make the world’s only scientifically proven and independently tested electrical shark deterrents – for real.

Our products provide peace of mind for ocean lovers around the world, while supporting the conservation of marine life by removing the need for shark nets, drum lines, and shark culling.

Government approved and developed over two decades of research, our patented technology creates a powerful three-dimensional electrical field which causes safe but unbearable spasms in shark’s short-range electrical receptors, turning sharks away - including Great Whites. Nothing is more effective.

Our existing products are primarily used for surfing, diving and kayak fishing, and for years we’ve been asked to bring a convenient handheld device to market. We are so excited to finally bring that product – the eSPEAR - to fruition!

Small, lightweight, easy to carry and backed by 20 years of research, the eSPEAR is perfect for spearfishing, diving and snorkelling. Simply attach the optional holster to your dive belt, or clip to your swimsuit or trunk and go!
column2:
>Imagine swimming on a coral reef knowing you have the protection of proven
Shark Shield Technology by your side
>EARLY HANDHELD CONCEPT eSPEAR TESTED ON OCEANIC WHITE TIP

column11: >eSPEAR SIZE AND  DIMENSIONS
column12: >eSPEAR PROTECTIVE ELECTRICAL FIELD
column15: >WHAT DIVERS SAY ABOUT SHARK SHIELD TECHNOLOGY
column16:
>Elyse Frankcom

“My name is Elyse Frankcom and I work as a professional snorkelling guide on an Eco-tour for swimming with wild dolphins. Safety is a big issue of course as we take many passengers into the ocean! I had an amazing experience with Ocean Guardian - Shark Shield Technology. I was free diving with dolphins, I didn't have my unit turned on and was recently attacked by a 3-metre Great White Shark! My first reaction was to punch and then try pushing the shark away while a very brave passenger pulled the tail! I remembered my Shark Shield wasn't on so I immediately turned it on and the shark dropped me and swam away as quick as it came!
I believe that if I didn't turn the Shark Shield on, I would not be alive today! The Shark Shield saved my life as well as everyone around me in the water. Never again will I enter the water without my unit turned on!”

Elyse Frankcom was 19 year old snorkel tour guide when she was attacked by a 3.7-metre great white shark while leading a wild dolphin swim near Perth, Western Australia in 2010.

column2: >“I’ve been involved in testing the Shark Shield Technology for over twenty years and there is no doubt about its effectiveness. I have tested the technology extensively with many species of sharks, including Great Whites, along with testing a very early proto type of the eSPEAR as a hand held shark deterrent. As you can see in the video testing with Oceanic White Tip Sharks it was very effective in deterring the shark.”

column1:
Why Indiegogo?

We’ve launched this Indiegogo campaign for 2 important reasons.

The first is to get the awesome new eSPEAR to market in time for the northern hemisphere summer and in a range of cool colours to suit personal preferences.

The second is to raise funds that will allow us to partner with one of Australia's leading universities in developing game-changing long-range shark deterrent technology that has the capability to replace inhumane shark nets around the world whilst protecting ocean users from the risk of a shark attack.

What do you get?

A sweet deal on the world’s first handheld electronic shark deterrent, the eSPEAR, and the opportunity to help rid the world of environmentally harmful and inhumane shark nets and drum lines.

How you're helping the environment?

The aim of our new long-range technology is to increase the shark deterrent electromagnetic range by developing new transducers with the capability of creating a deterrent level electromagnetic field at longer distances, ideally 30-50 metres in radius. This project has significant environmental outcomes with the potential for this new shark deterrent technology (the LR5000) to be used on beaches around the world in place of shark nets, drum lines or shark culling. Shark nets and drum kill thousands of innocent animals annually. 

Imagine a world where you don’t see images of dolphins, whales or turtles in shark nets. A world where you don’t have to read statistics on the heartbreaking by-catch of shark nets and drum lines.

This is a huge opportunity for shark human management and ocean conservation, and we invite you to join us on the journey.

Other Ways You Can Help?

Can’t back our campaign but still want to help? Use the Indiegogo share tools and shout out about it to your friends, family and colleagues!

My name is Alberta Henry and I was born and raised in Cameron, AZ, the East Gateway to the Grand Canyon National Park, in the far western region of the Navajo Nation. My family and I created the
column3: '> Big Hogan Enterprise to share the Navajo culture, language, and history with the tourists who visit the Grand Canyon. The Big Hogan
column5: '> is a traditional and sacred homestead for five generations of my family. We aspire to revitalize the Navajo culture, protect the natural resources and inspire visitors to become stewards of this sacred area by offering a unique cultural experience combined with the powerful beauty of the Little Colorado River.

column1: My business is selling the experience of my culture to tourists who pass through the area to visit the Grand Canyon every year. The Big Hogan Enterprise has withdrawn 50 acres of land from  the Navajo Nation  and will offer Hogans to rent, hikes to historic sites, a Hogan for viewing, and storytelling, Rustic camping and beautiful canyon views.

My goal is to raise $40,000 for the start-up phase which is primarily infrastructure for building supplies and basic infrastructure which includes solar, restrooms, bath houses, and underground water tanks by February 2019. This includes:

My family and a few investors have contributed the funds to build two hogans and purchase equipment to set up six tents with bedding. In order to offer more Hogan bed and breakfast and camping, we will need an additional $40,000 to cover basic infrastructure needed to operate a rustic experience in a safe, sanitary and comfortable place. The following is a breakdown of how the $40,000 will be spent:
Restrooms and bath houses for a total of $10,000
• 2 separate bath houses at $2,000 each which includes building supplies, shower stalls, window, door, skylight, solar light, solar water heater, and items for bathroom fixtures.

• Restroom building with 6 toilets (3 women and 3 men with wash stations) at $4,000 which includes building supplies, toilets, tank for water, tank for sewage, 2 windows, 2 doors, 4 skylights, solar lights, solar water heater, and Items for bathroom fixtures.
• 4 waterless restrooms/outhouses (these outhouses will have a small container with cedar or pine shavings to dump after each use) at $500 each which includes building supplies.
Off-grid solar power for a total of $13,500
• Off-grid solar power kit with 7320 Watts of Panels and 8800 Watt 48VDC 120/240VAC Inverter Power Panel at  $10,000
• 4 smaller off-grid solar panels with batteries at $2,000
Building materials for 2 Hogans for a total of $13,500
​Building materials, including windows, 2 doors, 2 skylights, furniture, bed, bedding, small light, small phone charger, small closet, and bedroom fixtures.
If we reach our goal of $40,000 we will be able to fund primarily the building supplies and basic infrastructure which includes solar, restrooms and bath houses.
We are excited to offer those who make financial contributions the following perks:

column2: $100 Lifetime membership which included a 10% discount on overnight accommodations.
$5,000 Lifetime membership and weekend camping free of charge and Big Hogan Enterprise t-shirt
$10,000 Lifetime membership, weekend camping free of charge, and engraving of name on metal gate

column1: We are incredibly grateful for your support. Anybody who contributes will get updates on our progress.
Privately owned businesses like Big Hogan Enterprise stimulate economic development. Less than 200 Navajos own businesses. $10,500 is the average per capita income.

Faced with limited income generation, families on the reservation are torn apart because parents have to move to construction sites for higher paying jobs, leaving children to be raised by their grandparents.

Grand Canyon National Park receives over 6 million visitors per year. The unique geography and location of the Navajo Reservation provides for remarkable opportunities to appeal to tourists of the Grand Canyon. The eastern entryway to the southern rim of Grand Canyon National Park is only a few miles from Navajo Nation and millions of tourists drive through the reservation each year. With the millions of tourists that come through there are only approximately 1000 rooms to rent on the reservation for overnight stays including hotels, motels, and bed and breakfasts. This causes the majority of overnight tourists to find accommodations off the reservation.

Of the millions of visitors each year approximately 28% indicated that their primary destination was the Navajo reservation according to a 2011 survey by Northern Arizona University. The majority come to view our scenic attractions and take in our beautiful landscapes. A vast majority would recommend to their friends and family that a trip to Navajo Nation is worth their time and money.  Combined with the proximity to the Grand Canyon National Park, Big Hogan has an incredible opportunity as many tourists come prepared to spend multiple days and nights and are willing to spend their money on the reservation.

The remoteness of the Big Hogan can be a challenge because we will have to run the business off-grid which will result in higher infrastructure costs such as hauling water, maintaining the roads, and telecommunication systems. As such, we will market to those who seek adventure and desire for an authentic experience with unique integration of culture and environmental responsibility. We will assure the safety of all visitors and sanitation of Big Hogan so that people can visit during all seasons.

Additionally, our company will face the challenges of tourism seasonality. One of our strategies is to offer diverse products and services. Off season, we hope to attract local families and businesses to have events and retreats at our location. Further, we will seek opportunities to partner with the Navajo Nation Parks and Recreation, Navajo Nation Tourism Department, Grand Canyon National Park, Coconino County, Cameron Chapter, and the local community and businesses.

We believe we can overcome any obstacles because our family is deeply rooted in this area which is an advantage to continue building relationships to strengthen and grow our business. Many of our family and community members know this business intimately as we have relied on the tourism industry since childhood because we survived by sharing our culture and language through tours, storytelling and artistic expression (e.g., arts and crafts).

Thank you for visiting the Big Hogan Enterprise page! We know not everyone can contribute monetarily but your interest and ability to share our story is just as meaningful to me and my family. You can share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools as well.

My name is Alberta Henry and I was born and raised in Cameron, AZ, the East Gateway to the Grand Canyon National Park, in the far western region of the Navajo Nation. My family and I created the Big Hogan Enterprise to share the Navajo culture, language, and history with the tourists who visit the Grand Canyon. The Big Hogan is a traditional and sacred homestead for five generations of my family. We aspire to revitalize the Navajo culture, protect the natural resources and inspire visitors to become stewards of this sacred area by offering a unique cultural experience combined with the powerful beauty of the Little Colorado River.

My business is selling the experience of my culture to tourists who pass through the area to visit the Grand Canyon every year. The Big Hogan Enterprise has withdrawn 50 acres of land from  the Navajo Nation  and will offer Hogans to rent, hikes to historic sites, a Hogan for viewing, and storytelling, Rustic camping and beautiful canyon views.

My goal is to raise $40,000 for the start-up phase which is primarily infrastructure for building supplies and basic infrastructure which includes solar, restrooms, bath houses, and underground water tanks by February 2019. This includes:
What We Need & What You Get

My family and a few investors have contributed the funds to build two hogans and purchase equipment to set up six tents with bedding. In order to offer more Hogan bed and breakfast and camping, we will need an additional $40,000 to cover basic infrastructure needed to operate a rustic experience in a safe, sanitary and comfortable place. The following is a breakdown of how the $40,000 will be spent:
Restrooms and bath houses for a total of $10,000
2 separate bath houses at $2,000 each which includes building supplies, shower stalls, window, door, skylight, solar light, solar water heater, and items for bathroom fixtures.

Restroom building with 6 toilets (3 women and 3 men with wash stations) at $4,000 which includes building supplies, toilets, tank for water, tank for sewage, 2 windows, 2 doors, 4 skylights, solar lights, solar water heater, and Items for bathroom fixtures.
4 waterless restrooms/outhouses (these outhouses will have a small container with cedar or pine shavings to dump after each use) at $500 each which includes building supplies.
Water tanks for a total of $3,000
Off-grid solar power for a total of $13,500
Off-grid solar power kit with 7320 Watts of Panels and 8800 Watt 48VDC 120/240VAC Inverter Power Panel at  $10,000
4 smaller off-grid solar panels with batteries at $2,000
Building materials for 2 Hogans for a total of $13,500
​Building materials, including windows, 2 doors, 2 skylights, furniture, bed, bedding, small light, small phone charger, small closet, and bedroom fixtures.
If we reach our goal of $40,000 we will be able to fund primarily the building supplies and basic infrastructure which includes solar, restrooms and bath houses.
We are excited to offer those who make financial contributions the following perks:
<$100 Lifetime membership which included a 10% discount on overnight accommodations.
<$5,000 Lifetime membership and weekend camping free of charge and Big Hogan Enterprise t-shirt
<$10,000 Lifetime membership, weekend camping free of charge, and engraving of name on metal gate
We are incredibly grateful for your support. Anybody who contributes will get updates on our progress.
