We’re not a tour. We’re a little bit different: we’re a shared rental.

Imagine sharing a road trip with 9 other backpackers, travelling along red dirt roads, and stopping at waterfalls and gorges as you like. Making your own decisions. You’ve got everything you need for camping, cooking and fun and every night you camp and enjoy a meal together (and a few cheeky drinks) under amazing starry skies. The stars are so good because there’s no light from any cities around in the middle of nowhere.

This is us, Share Bus. We help travellers like you go on flexible, affordable, self-guided camping road trips.  We rent out our minibus and trailers full of camping, (glamping) and cooking equipment to a group of backpackers to do road trips. The start and end dates are fixed, but the route is totally flexible!
We want to take our next step and create a 4WD set-up.
We want to help you travel to more remote places
column2: the real famous Australian places like along the Gibb River Road in Northern Western Australia. Or to the very best waterfalls in Kakadu National Park.

column1: However, we need a 4WD vehicle and off-road trailer.

And a 4WD that can carry a large group is a big expense for us. So we'd like to invite you to help us 'Share the Bus' by contributing something and receiving one of our perks (which include highly discounted trips!)

We are Marco and Jade, plus a few helpers around the country who prepare the bus for the trips, and help us promote Share Bus. We started Share Bus about a year and a half ago, with our old 1999 Toyota Hiace ""Betty"".
Now Betty is being retired, and we have upgraded to 3 much newer Toyota Hiace, and learnt all the lessons that come with running a business for its first year.

We are both travellers ourselves. Marco is Italian and first came to Australia in 2012 on a working holiday Visa. After a lot of hard work he managed to get sponsored and stay in Australia as an engineer, but now works on his own projects, like Share Bus and running hostels in Perth. Jade is from Perth, Australia and spent a lot of time travelling after finishing university. After trying lots of different things after getting home she now works full time on building Share Bus, and teaches piano on the side.

Why did we start Share Bus? I guess we thought there was a better way. We think young travellers today are looking for ways to be more independent and flexible, than going on a tour. We thought we could help them do that in a way that still provided what they needed, and allow them the opportunity to travel in a group.
This is a rough budget of the costs involved in building a new set-up
THE OFF ROAD TRAILER WE ARE BUILDING

On one side there is a small door that opens out, with a large esky on slide-out rails. There is a table which folds out from the side, which you can use to cook your meals on. The kitchen equipment and gas cooker are easily accessible on the shelves above the table.

Above the fridge you will find self-inflating mattresses and tents. On the other side there are more shelves, which you can store your backpacks and bags on. The doors open at the sides, so you can easily access them every day.
This is what our current completed 2WD trailer/minibus set up currently looks like
The complete trailer: Boxes with camping, cooking equipment on one side
column2: with the gas stove, slide out esky, and cooking bench on this side as well. On the other side is shelves for your bags

column1: Equipment list printed on the inside of the door. Each header is a box: so you will know where you can get stuff!

We've pretty much thought of everything. In this picture you can see the tables, benches, 100 litres of water, a guitar, a bucket to do your washing up in and a broom (because you've got to clean it at the end
WHERE YOU CAN GO WITH A 4WD IN AUSTRALIA

You'll see the real outback. On the trip we want to use this vehicle for you will see places like Windjana Gorge (crocodiles) and Tunnel Creek, WA's oldest cave system.  You can visit yourself, and wade through the puddles which will see you wading through pools of water in the cave. You can also see incredible Bell Gorge, Manning Gorge and Emma Gorge. You can explore Kakadu and see even more swimming holes, gorges and waterfalls. Here are a few photos that speak for themselves.
We’re not a tour. We’re a little bit different: we’re a shared rental.

Imagine sharing a road trip with 9 other backpackers, travelling along red dirt roads, and stopping at waterfalls and gorges as you like. Making your own decisions. You’ve got everything you need for camping, cooking and fun and every night you camp and enjoy a meal together (and a few cheeky drinks) under amazing starry skies. The stars are so good because there’s no light from any cities around in the middle of nowhere.

This is us, Share Bus. The start and end dates are fixed, but the route is totally flexible!
WHAT WE ARE RAISING FUNDS FOR
We want to take our next step and create a 4WD set-up.
We want to help you travel to more remote places

THE OFF ROAD TRAILER WE ARE BUILDING

On one side there is a small door that opens out, with a large esky on slide-out rails. There is a table which folds out from the side, which you can use to cook your meals on. The kitchen equipment and gas cooker are easily accessible on the shelves above the table.

Above the fridge you will find self-inflating mattresses and tents. On the other side there are more shelves, which you can store your backpacks and bags on. The doors open at the sides, so you can easily access them every day.
This is what our current completed 2WD trailer/minibus set up currently looks like
The complete trailer: Boxes with camping, cooking equipment on one side
column2: with the gas stove, slide out esky, and cooking bench on this side as well. On the other side is shelves for your bags

column1: Equipment list printed on the inside of the door. Each header is a box: so you will know where you can get stuff!

We've pretty much thought of everything. In this picture you can see the tables, benches, 100 litres of water, a guitar, a bucket to do your washing up in and a broom (because you've got to clean it at the end
WHERE YOU CAN GO WITH A 4WD IN AUSTRALIA

You'll see the real outback. On the trip we want to use this vehicle for you will see places like Windjana Gorge (crocodiles) and Tunnel Creek, WA's oldest cave system.  You can visit yourself, and wade through the puddles which will see you wading through pools of water in the cave. You can also see incredible Bell Gorge, Manning Gorge and Emma Gorge. You can explore Kakadu and see even more swimming holes, gorges and waterfalls. Here are a few photos that speak for themselves.
How to Make and Save Money While Traveling
Learning From Experienced World Travelers will help you live your dream of traveling and making the money you need to keep going... indefinitely, if you desire.

The authors, Michael and Melissa have traveled extensively and compiled an eBook that shares their travel experiences, along with other stories of fellow travelers, that will help you live an adventurous life without worrying about money.
This campaign is about YOU.  We want to help you and other travelers learn from our experiences and thrive while on your own journeys.
By funding this project, you will publish the eBook via the Kindle platform and a downloadable PDF version for those who do not have Kindle.

Using the experience provided in this book, you will make and save more money than the money you spent on this book, which gets you one step closer to exploring the world.  This eBook is loaded with stories, information, humor, and many ah-ha moments!

The book is already 75% complete and just needs the polishing touches (and your support).  We aren't spending loads of money on cover design artwork, printing and all the things authors get caught up buying.  This is a no-nonsense eBook that will provide many years of value from the budget traveler to the executive on the go.
This eBook would make an amazing and inexpensive gift.
We wrote this book primarily to help others be adventurous

We developed the Tow Bike to solve four main issues that people have when they want to transport a motorcycle:
• Loading a motorcycle onto a normal trailer using ramps is difficult and dangerous.
• Most people do not have sufficient space to store a motorcycle trailer, especially in densely populated areas like The Netherlands
• A motorcycle trailer with ground level loading is expensive.
• Buying a motorcycle trailer means that you have to go out to a store, it will never be sent to you in a box.

I enjoy racing motorcycles with friends over week-ends, and we always have the same problem - how to transport race bikes to the tracks. Then my wife and I have another problem, how to take a large tent/supplies/water and the bicycles with us on holiday.

You see, we use bicycles a lot in Holland - and the country is also very densely populated, so real estate is precious. If we bought a trailer to transport either motorcycles, bicycles or camping gear, where would we put it?

I discussed these issues with a friend of mine that is an Industrial Designer - he has previously designed race related vehicles...we did some research too, and we discovered that my Honda CBR actually has the same length as my friend's Audi A3's width!

column2: >So we thought about designing a motorcycle trailer where the bike sits sideways. You won't need a frame or a floor, so that you can just lift it by the draw bar and lean it against the wall! Once the storage problem solved, and the motorcycle problem solved too, we realized that we actually have enough space on the back of it for 200kg of supplies and a large tent.

column1: All the funds that we raise will be used to set up series production of the Tow Bike. We will not use the funds for personal consumption because the members of our team still have other incomes.
What we offer our backers is an innovative and well prized product that is intended for the road transport of a scooter, a medium sized motorcycle, bicycles, camping equipment and supplies.
Innovative because there is no motorcycle trailer on the market that offers ground level loading of your motorcycle and also allows you to take 200 kg of supplies (tent, tools, parts, food &
But if you do not have a motorcycle, you can use the Tow Bike to load 4 mountain bikes and take 200 kg of supplies for a nice weekend in the woods.
This instant storage compact trailer has a HUGE loading
area at the back for luggage, an extra motorcycle, bicycles, camping gear, surf
boards (not longboards), a generator, food, water, a barbecue etc. When you get
to your destination and unpack, just flip the trailer up against a tree or a
wall to get it out of the way. There is no other trailer on the market that
offer you these options, including the sideways ground loading feature.
For example, say you transport a motorcycle to a mate that lives downtown.
If you show up with a tow bike, not only you can easily offload the bike, but
when you're done then you can lean the trailer against a wall or tree on the sidewalk
and you can park the car in a normal parking spot - no other trailer on the

column1: We developed the Tow Bike to solve four main issues that people have when they want to transport a motorcycle:
Loading a motorcycle onto a normal trailer using ramps is difficult and dangerous.
Most people do not have sufficient space to store a motorcycle trailer, especially in densely populated areas like The Netherlands
A motorcycle trailer with ground level loading is expensive.
Buying a motorcycle trailer means that you have to go out to a store, it will never be sent to you in a box.

I enjoy racing motorcycles with friends over week-ends, and we always have the same problem - how to transport race bikes to the tracks. Then my wife and I have another problem, how to take a large tent/supplies/water and the bicycles with us on holiday.

You see, we use bicycles a lot in Holland - and the country is also very densely populated, so real estate is precious. If we bought a trailer to transport either motorcycles, bicycles or camping gear, where would we put it?

I discussed these issues with a friend of mine that is an Industrial Designer - he has previously designed race related vehicles...we did some research too, and we discovered that my Honda CBR actually has the same length as my friend's Audi A3's width!

So we thought about designing a motorcycle trailer where the bike sits sideways. You won't need a frame or a floor, so that you can just lift it by the draw bar and lean it against the wall! Once the storage problem solved, and the motorcycle problem solved too, we realized that we actually have enough space on the back of it for 200kg of supplies and a large tent.
What We Need & What You Get
All the funds that we raise will be used to set up series production of the Tow Bike. We will not use the funds for personal consumption because the members of our team still have other incomes.
What we offer our backers is an innovative and well prized product that is intended for the road transport of a scooter, a medium sized motorcycle, bicycles, camping equipment and supplies.

Innovative because there is no motorcycle trailer on the market that offers ground level loading of your motorcycle and also allows you to take 200 kg of supplies (tent, tools, parts, food & beverage etc) with you.
But if you do not have a motorcycle, you can use the Tow Bike to load 4 mountain bikes and take 200 kg of supplies for a nice weekend in the woods.
This instant storage compact trailer has a HUGE loading
area at the back for luggage, an extra motorcycle, bicycles, camping gear, surf
boards (not longboards), a generator, food, water, a barbecue etc. When you get
to your destination and unpack, just flip the trailer up against a tree or a
wall to get it out of the way. There is no other trailer on the market that
offer you these options, including the sideways ground loading feature.
For example, say you transport a motorcycle to a mate that lives downtown.
If you show up with a tow bike, not only you can easily offload the bike, but
when you're done then you can lean the trailer against a wall or tree on the sidewalk
and you can park the car in a normal parking spot - no other trailer on the

Tow Bike offers a range of unique, ground level loading trailers for transporting motorcycles, scooters and bicycles. The ground level loading is lateral. These trailers can be equipped with several accessories such as camping sets, large storage boxes, universal trays, bicycle carriers, etc.
Motorcycle, storage box and jerry can
Instant storage. Lean the Tow Bike against a wall to get it out of the way.
Self-loading, sequential motorized ramp and lift systemTechnical specifications:
LIFT SYSTEM 'MINI' and 'MAXI': Hand crank/power tool/fin cooled, lubricated, self-locking worm drive
LOADING By driving or pushing the motorcycle up the ramp
LOADING SELF - LOADING sequential motorized ramp and lift system
CHASSIS 3D laser cut, fully welded and galvanised
DRAW BAR 60mm square steel section, KNOTT (Germany)
TIRES 8in tires, 16,5 x 6,50 - 8PR rated at 410kg each
SUSPENSION Independent Rubber Suspension, 750kg KNOTT (Germany), unbraked
ELECTRIC SYSTEM 12VDC, Aspock (Austria) watertight, bayonet fittings
ELECTRIC PLUG EU standard 13 pin, adapters for 7 in, USA, Australia
LIGHTS Position, brake, fog light, reverse light, indicator, fwd white light
NUMBER PLATE EU or US standard, LED illuminated

The most widely used modern suspensions in Europe are independent rubber suspensions. Each wheel has independent suspension, as opposed to a stiff beam with leaf springs - in this case, if one wheel hits a pothole, then the other wheel reacts too, resulting in instability.

In the IRS (Independent Rubber Suspension) axle, there is no contact between the swing arms and the axle casing. This takes out the low vibrations from the road surface, sparing all components including the chassis of vibration fatigue. Besides, it runs very quiet and is maintenance free for many years. The axle is dimensioned for 750kg, however IRS axles are regularly overloaded without any harm coming to them. The two tires, although 8in in diameter, are rated at DOUBLE the max payload - to ensure you will enjoy a long and safe tire life.

The chassis, once fully welded, is extremely strong. All components are either 2D or 3D laser cut with 0.1mm precision. It is robotically welded, resulting in an impeccable product that is Zn coated, rather than galvanized.
Compared to conventional trailer chassis, where the parts are bolted or riveted, this construction offers superior rigidity and stiffness while it is quite light.
The chassis has been computer designed with a safety factor of 10:1 in static stress. Dynamically, it will take roughly 3 times the listed payload, without problems.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

Meridian is an interactive album of your experiences around the world.
Saving your favorite memories from past adventures is now easy as pie: just search for the place that you visited, select the photos and videos that you want to add, and that's it!

Meridian will automatically upload your album, in HD, to your personal cloud. So your adventure will be safe forever. If you want to elaborate, you can add comments and remember those special details that happened behind the scenes later on.
Your experiences are organized and presented in a beautiful way
Choose from 3 map styles: classic, modern, satellite
Your album is everywhere, safe and with you. The iPad version is included!
In order to provide the best service quality possible, we rely on multiple awesome premium services. Here's a estimated cost distribution:

Meridian is a universal iOS app written mostly in Swift. As of the infrastructure, we rely heavily on the well-known Facebook's Parse and Amazon S3 services in order to provide a great experience and make sure that your photos and videos are safe. This also lets us forget about maintaining servers on our own and focus completely on what's truly important: making Meridian a top notch product.

We are a duet passionated about how technology can make people's life even more enjoyable. David is a talented developer and speedcuber, while Manu is a designer with a sharp eye for details. We both focus on providing the best experience possible. With Meridian, we're commited to put our travelling adventures in the special place they deserve.
Will I get my cloud plan activated as soon as I get the first beta?
Not yet, the first beta version won't include cloud plans, but it's pretty likely we'll introduce them during the beta period at a further beta release.
Is there any estimated date for the delivery of the public version?
We'll start distributing the beta version in December, and plan to get to the App Store by January.
We have plenty of ideas to make Meridian amazing! The best part about the concept is its versatility, which allows us to think and focus about expanding to many other platforms, such as the web.
Other than contributing, how can I help?
Even if you are not backing Meridian but like the project anyway, you can spread the word about Meridian via Twitter, Facebook, email, etc. You can find the share links at the top of this page.
It's only your help what will help us reach our goal!
The campaign video that you see above happened thanks to our friend Bea Hohenleiter, a talented photographer &
column2:
videomaker. You can email us with your questions and concerns at hi@deerduet.com, or ping us @Deerduet on Twitter.

Crafted in the UK using environmentally friendly faux leather and solid metals, to ensure it can travel through all of your adventures. Each FlagMate holds up to 30 Flags.
Available with a clip to attach anywhere you like... (Length 13.5cm x 2.7cm width)
Also available without a clip to use as an elegant and stylish keyring (Length 8.5cm x 2.7cm width)
The Storyteller Flags are custom made and individually hand-painted, with an elegant smooth finish.
With the added option to personalise the back of each flag using up to 36 characters.
If you prefer not to personalise your Flag, we will simply add the name of the country on the back (if you're like us and can't remember each country flag this will be useful!)
Use it to share your travel stories with other travellers.
Changing the way travellers collect their special memories

We wanted to design a solution to address a major pain point for travellers around the world of how to best preserve their travel memories. We combined the longevity of a journal with the simplicity of a souvenir.
1. CHOOSE THE STORYTELLER FLAG OF EACH COUNTRY YOU HAVE VISITED OR ARE GOING TO VISIT
2. AN OPTION TO ADD A SPECIAL MESSAGE, MEMORY OR DATE ON THE BACK OF THE FLAG. IF NOT, WE WILL SIMPLY ADD THE NAME OF THE COUNTRY ON THE BACK
3. ADD THE STORYTELLER FLAG TO YOUR FLAGMATE
Storyteller was started with three main objectives:
1) To build the best travel accessories using environmentally friendly materials.
2) Inspire more people to travel the world (we LOVE to travel!)
3) Fund educational projects for individuals in underprivileged areas of the world.

Travelling allows us to witness some incredible sights, taste the most amazing food and create special memories that will always stay with us. It is also one of the best teachers outside of the classroom and helps so many of us grow as individuals.

Although travelling the world shows us so many positives, it also shows us the world’s biggest problems. Recent UNESCO figures show that there are 750 million youth and adults who are unable to read and write a simple sentence.
This not only has long-term consequences for those individuals affected, but also for the next generation, who become part of a repeat cycle of inequality and poverty.

At Storyteller, we are passionate about wanting to make a real change to this problem and to do this, we have partnered with like-minded charities to work with and help fund educational projects for both children and adults in less privileged areas of the world.
Our charity partners are The Barefoot College (work in 93 countries worldwide), Global Citizen (worldwide) and The Hope Foundation (work in India, Kolkata).
It is our vision at Storyteller to inspire people to travel more but also bring together passionate travellers from around the world in unity with a mission to do good.
We hope you will support and join us on this journey of empowerment as together, we can make a difference.
Learn more about how we do good and the full list of projects we want to deliver: https://www.storytellertravel.co.uk/do-good/our-projects/
Now you have learned about Storyteller and FlagMate, we would like to take a moment to introduce you to the minds behind the company.

The founder of Storyteller is Bhav Patel. Having practiced as a Lawyer for many years, he has led many Corporate Social Responsibility programmes, which has allowed him to work closely with large charities and understand the technical details of how the sector operates. He has since put this knowledge into practice by becoming an integral member of the UNICEF, NextGen, London team.

When Bhav first had the idea about creating FlagMate, he wanted to ensure that the company stood for two values that he was most passionate about, his love for travel and giving back to those less fortunate. He wanted to showcase the positives of travel, but also use this platform to show the educational problems around the world and create a community of like-minded people to come together and help resolve these problems. He says:

“Travelling the world has allowed me to see and meet so many adults who are completely illiterate. That is when it clicked. It was a repeat cycle, children could not obtain a quality education, and they were then growing as adults who were completely illiterate. I wanted to make a change and so made a conscious decision to ensure that an integral part of Storyteller would be to focus on a mission to do good, and help fund and run educational workshops for both children and adults.”
The Storyteller team has since grown with like-minded individuals from backgrounds in law, branding, marketing, fashion and product design and the charity sector.
Although we all have our own expertise, we all have two things in common, the love of travel and the passion to do good.

At Storyteller, we are passionate about using environmentally friendly and sustainable materials for our products. From the printing of our clothing to the materials used in our products and packaging, we use the best progressive and sustainable materials. Some of the materials we use include recycled card, plant-based materials, and non-PVC polyurethane microfibre.
Once we settled on the concept of FlagMate, we began to design and develop a product which was durable and able to go through all types of weather.
Together with our design team, we created the prototype of FlagMate and the Flags, and then gave them to 10 different individuals to test, for a period of three months.

The feedback was great, but the two issues raised were that the design wasn't very appealing and second, the flags were hitting against the faux leather at the bottom, causing wear and tear. To improve the design and strengthen the product, we added a nickel plated metal block to create an innovative design and importantly, separate the faux leather from the flags, reducing any wear and tear.
We rounded off the FlagMate by using cross coloured stitching and embossing our favourite, passport style stamped logo into the high-quality faux leather.
Finally, we added an option to have a clip, which was durable and able to hold a large number of flags.

When we first created the Flags, they were computer printed. However, when we got the first look, there was something missing, it was the personal touch. We, therefore, enhanced the Flag in two different ways.
The flags were changed from computer print to each one individually created. The flag designs are drawn into a piece of metal after which they are each hand-painted one by one.
The other enhancement we made was to laser add the option to laser engrave a special message to the back of each Storyteller Flag. The perfect way to capture your special memories.
After sampling hundreds of tees, we finally found the perfect material, a mix of organic cotton and bamboo which is quick dry, wind resistant, comfortable and long-lasting in both material and style.
The bamboo is ethically sourced from China where it is pressed and crushed mechanically before being sent to India where it is produced sustainably creating the perfect tee for every traveller!
We even tested them to make sure they were very very wind resistant…

Hand-Made, designed and produced by our team member, as a thank you for our special backers we are offering a LIMITED quantity of 25 Camoflouge cotton jumpers with our special white logo! As it is hand-made we can craft this to be the perfect fit for you!
These jumpers are soft, comfortable and visually beautiful!

Our chosen manufacturers have produced the best prototypes throughout this project. Given their years of experience in materials and product design, we have obtained high-quality advice on the quality and durability of the materials we use, allowing us to ensure the products are of the highest quality possible.
We will be announcing stretch goals very soon, but if we hit our target of £5,000.00 we will be able to this FlagMate variation:

Our manufacturers are able to deliver within 4 months of this crowdfunding campaign ending and therefore at the latest, we aim to start shipping orders by 30 August 2018. If we surpass our funding goals substantially, we may need some extra time to fulfill orders. If this is the case we will update each and every single one of you with a new time frame.

Over the last eight months, we have continuously developed our products and are super proud of the results. As with any product going into production, there are risks, but we have worked hard to minimise these. For example, production delays, which we have allowed for in our timeline.
We will be as open as possible with you throughout the rest of the project and beyond, posting regular updates (here and on facebook and twitter) every step of the way.
We need your help to spread the word about us and ensure that people are aware of our mission to do good around the world.
Share our campaign page and tag us on social media!
Stay updated with everything Storyteller and follow our travels on social:
Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Storyteller.
You've heard from us and now we'd love to hear from you.

Please note that our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all questions and comments that are left on the comments page as soon as possible but the easiest way to get immediate assistance is to email us at hello@storytellertravel.co.uk

We love hearing from backers with any feedback, requests or just to say hi, so please do drop us an email or contact us on social media (tags above) where you can also see the latest information an all things Storyteller.
For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please visit: https://www.storytellertravel.co.uk/wholesale/
Your support is going to allow us to start our journey, and help us make an impact in the world we live in. We are all very thankful for your support.
Although we cannot offer refunds on the Storyteller FlagMate or Storyteller World Flags, we are able to offer an exchange on our bamboo tees for customers in the UK only.
Please note that all international sale are final, i.e. we can not accept returns or exchanges for any items.

For refunds during the campaign, this can be processed, through Indiegogo provided the campaign is live and not ended, the perk claimed has not been fulfilled, and the funds have not been transferred to Storyteller.
2) Who is responsible for international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees?
You are responsible for any extra fees that may be applied when shipped to/arriving in your country. This includes international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees.
3) Are you a charity or a full profit company?

We are a full profit company with a positive conscience. We give from our profits as we believe doing good is integral. We do, however, partner with registered charities who we fund to run educational programmes around the world. We are just doing our bit and hope you will join us in doing yours too.
4) How do I tell you which Storyteller Flags and Engraving I require?

Get your list ready and we will be in contact after the campaign has ended with a questionnaire for you to send this information across to us. That way if you have any trips between now and April you can get those flags in advance too!
5) I want to buy individual additional flags in addition to these perks, can I do this?
As our prices are based on an overall discounted bundle, the prices for individual Storyteller Flags are slightly higher (but still discounted from our RRP price of £6.99) at a cost of £4.99 each.
If you have purchased a bundle with over 25 Storyteller Flags, we will discount each additional Flag to £3.49 each.
To purchase, simply work out the price and contribute this through the ""Make a Contribution"" part in the perk box and send us an email at hello@storytellertravel.co.uk advising of your purchase.
6) What size Storyteller Bamboo T-shirts do I need?
They are unisex t-shirts and they come in Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large.

We do however advise that you buy a size which is slightly smaller than your normal size as these t-shirts are comfort fit and therefore are slightly bigger than normal UK/EU size t-shirts.  For men, if you are a medium fit, and you want a slightly fitted look, we recommend buying a small size. For women, if you are a size 8/10 we recommend a size small tee.
7) Are the FlagMates and Storyteller Flags water resistant?

We have done our best to create an item which will work through storms and rain hit areas when you are travelling. Having tested the product, although it will withstand water and simply dry out, we highly advise to keep it in the best condition, not to let it soak in water or stay in wet weather for very long.
8) How can I upgrade my perk?
Please contribute the difference through the ""Thank You"" Perk and send us an email at hello@storytellertravel.co.uk advising of your upgrade.
We ship to most countries, with some exceptions due to regulatory restrictions outside of our control. In the next step you can select your country and see the shipping cost related to that country.

column3: '>10) When will you ship and when will I get my Storyteller products?

column1: The Indiegogo campaign is due to end on 1 April 2018. Once we have collated all of the orders, we will work with our manufacturers to start production with a date of 30 August 2018 to obtain and post out all of your fantastic products! We are based in the UK and therefore, orders within the UK and EU will take around 5-7 days, for orders worldwide please allow a slightly longer period (we believe this is approximately 2-3 weeks).
Crafted in the UK using environmentally friendly faux leather and solid metals, to ensure it can travel through all of your adventures. Each FlagMate holds up to 30 Flags.
Available with a clip to attach anywhere you like... (Length 13.5cm x 2.7cm width)
Also available without a clip to use as an elegant and stylish keyring (Length 8.5cm x 2.7cm width)
The Storyteller Flags are custom made and individually hand-painted, with an elegant smooth finish.
With the added option to personalise the back of each flag using up to 36 characters.
If you prefer not to personalise your Flag, we will simply add the name of the country on the back (if you're like us and can't remember each country flag this will be useful!)
Use it to share your travel stories with other travellers.
Changing the way travellers collect their special memories

We wanted to design a solution to address a major pain point for travellers around the world of how to best preserve their travel memories. We combined the longevity of a journal with the simplicity of a souvenir.
1. CHOOSE THE STORYTELLER FLAG OF EACH COUNTRY YOU HAVE VISITED OR ARE GOING TO VISIT
2. AN OPTION TO ADD A SPECIAL MESSAGE, MEMORY OR DATE ON THE BACK OF THE FLAG. IF NOT, WE WILL SIMPLY ADD THE NAME OF THE COUNTRY ON THE BACK
3. ADD THE STORYTELLER FLAG TO YOUR FLAGMATE
Storyteller was started with three main objectives:
1) To build the best travel accessories using environmentally friendly materials.
2) Inspire more people to travel the world (we LOVE to travel!)
3) Fund educational projects for individuals in underprivileged areas of the world.

Travelling allows us to witness some incredible sights, taste the most amazing food and create special memories that will always stay with us. It is also one of the best teachers outside of the classroom and helps so many of us grow as individuals.

Although travelling the world shows us so many positives, it also shows us the world’s biggest problems. Recent UNESCO figures show that there are 750 million youth and adults who are unable to read and write a simple sentence.
This not only has long-term consequences for those individuals affected, but also for the next generation, who become part of a repeat cycle of inequality and poverty.

At Storyteller, we are passionate about wanting to make a real change to this problem and to do this, we have partnered with like-minded charities to work with and help fund educational projects for both children and adults in less privileged areas of the world.
Our charity partners are The Barefoot College (work in 93 countries worldwide), Global Citizen (worldwide) and The Hope Foundation (work in India, Kolkata).
It is our vision at Storyteller to inspire people to travel more but also bring together passionate travellers from around the world in unity with a mission to do good.
We hope you will support and join us on this journey of empowerment as together, we can make a difference.
Learn more about how we do good and the full list of projects we want to deliver: https://www.storytellertravel.co.uk/do-good/our-projects/
Now you have learned about Storyteller and FlagMate, we would like to take a moment to introduce you to the minds behind the company.

The founder of Storyteller is Bhav Patel. Having practiced as a Lawyer for many years, he has led many Corporate Social Responsibility programmes, which has allowed him to work closely with large charities and understand the technical details of how the sector operates. He has since put this knowledge into practice by becoming an integral member of the UNICEF, NextGen, London team.

When Bhav first had the idea about creating FlagMate, he wanted to ensure that the company stood for two values that he was most passionate about, his love for travel and giving back to those less fortunate. He wanted to showcase the positives of travel, but also use this platform to show the educational problems around the world and create a community of like-minded people to come together and help resolve these problems. He says:

“Travelling the world has allowed me to see and meet so many adults who are completely illiterate. That is when it clicked. It was a repeat cycle, children could not obtain a quality education, and they were then growing as adults who were completely illiterate. I wanted to make a change and so made a conscious decision to ensure that an integral part of Storyteller would be to focus on a mission to do good, and help fund and run educational workshops for both children and adults.”
The Storyteller team has since grown with like-minded individuals from backgrounds in law, branding, marketing, fashion and product design and the charity sector.
Although we all have our own expertise, we all have two things in common, the love of travel and the passion to do good.

At Storyteller, we are passionate about using environmentally friendly and sustainable materials for our products. From the printing of our clothing to the materials used in our products and packaging, we use the best progressive and sustainable materials. Some of the materials we use include recycled card, plant-based materials, and non-PVC polyurethane microfibre.
Once we settled on the concept of FlagMate, we began to design and develop a product which was durable and able to go through all types of weather.
Together with our design team, we created the prototype of FlagMate and the Flags, and then gave them to 10 different individuals to test, for a period of three months.

The feedback was great, but the two issues raised were that the design wasn't very appealing and second, the flags were hitting against the faux leather at the bottom, causing wear and tear. To improve the design and strengthen the product, we added a nickel plated metal block to create an innovative design and importantly, separate the faux leather from the flags, reducing any wear and tear.
We rounded off the FlagMate by using cross coloured stitching and embossing our favourite, passport style stamped logo into the high-quality faux leather.
Finally, we added an option to have a clip, which was durable and able to hold a large number of flags.

When we first created the Flags, they were computer printed. However, when we got the first look, there was something missing, it was the personal touch. We, therefore, enhanced the Flag in two different ways.
The flags were changed from computer print to each one individually created. The flag designs are drawn into a piece of metal after which they are each hand-painted one by one.
The other enhancement we made was to laser add the option to laser engrave a special message to the back of each Storyteller Flag. The perfect way to capture your special memories.
After sampling hundreds of tees, we finally found the perfect material, a mix of organic cotton and bamboo which is quick dry, wind resistant, comfortable and long-lasting in both material and style.
The bamboo is ethically sourced from China where it is pressed and crushed mechanically before being sent to India where it is produced sustainably creating the perfect tee for every traveller!
We even tested them to make sure they were very very wind resistant…
Unique PERK for THIS CAMPAIGN ONLY:

Hand-Made, designed and produced by our team member, as a thank you for our special backers we are offering a LIMITED quantity of 25 Camoflouge cotton jumpers with our special white logo! As it is hand-made we can craft this to be the perfect fit for you!
These jumpers are soft, comfortable and visually beautiful!

Our chosen manufacturers have produced the best prototypes throughout this project. Given their years of experience in materials and product design, we have obtained high-quality advice on the quality and durability of the materials we use, allowing us to ensure the products are of the highest quality possible.
How the funds will be used
We will be announcing stretch goals very soon, but if we hit our target of £5,000.00 we will be able to this FlagMate variation:

Our manufacturers are able to deliver within 4 months of this crowdfunding campaign ending and therefore at the latest, we aim to start shipping orders by 30 August 2018. If we surpass our funding goals substantially, we may need some extra time to fulfill orders. If this is the case we will update each and every single one of you with a new time frame.

Over the last eight months, we have continuously developed our products and are super proud of the results. As with any product going into production, there are risks, but we have worked hard to minimise these. For example, production delays, which we have allowed for in our timeline.
We will be as open as possible with you throughout the rest of the project and beyond, posting regular updates (here and on facebook and twitter) every step of the way.
Other Ways You Can Support us!
We need your help to spread the word about us and ensure that people are aware of our mission to do good around the world.
Share our campaign page and tag us on social media!
Stay updated with everything Storyteller and follow our travels on social:
Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Storyteller.
You've heard from us and now we'd love to hear from you.

Please note that our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all questions and comments that are left on the comments page as soon as possible but the easiest way to get immediate assistance is to email us at hello@storytellertravel.co.uk

We love hearing from backers with any feedback, requests or just to say hi, so please do drop us an email or contact us on social media (tags above) where you can also see the latest information an all things Storyteller.
For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please visit: https://www.storytellertravel.co.uk/wholesale/
Your support is going to allow us to start our journey, and help us make an impact in the world we live in. We are all very thankful for your support.
Although we cannot offer refunds on the Storyteller FlagMate or Storyteller World Flags, we are able to offer an exchange on our bamboo tees for customers in the UK only.
Please note that all international sale are final, i.e. we can not accept returns or exchanges for any items.

For refunds during the campaign, this can be processed, through Indiegogo provided the campaign is live and not ended, the perk claimed has not been fulfilled, and the funds have not been transferred to Storyteller.
2) Who is responsible for international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees?
You are responsible for any extra fees that may be applied when shipped to/arriving in your country. This includes international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees.
3) Are you a charity or a full profit company?

We are a full profit company with a positive conscience. We give from our profits as we believe doing good is integral. We do, however, partner with registered charities who we fund to run educational programmes around the world. We are just doing our bit and hope you will join us in doing yours too.

My brother and I have taken the reigns to our families farming business. A business that struggled for many years due to unforeseen difficulties of the agriculture industry that our family-faced. Now, as the second generation farmers with extreme amounts of integrity when it comes to expanding out agriculture operation, we want to create a more inviting destination for people to come and visit, while also being able to experience an educational agricultural experience. Raised in the heart of the Great Smoky Mountains, we have always aimed to integrate our surroundings, while implementing geographical, cultural, and educational factors that brought our family to this beautiful farm. Now we have visitors from all over the world that come to the Great Smoky Mountains, and we want to give them a destination, that's oriented for everyone!
The proceeds for our campaign with go towards the working capital, supplies, and costs needed for the agritourism expansion, that will eventually include the following :
• ""U-Pick"" Apple Orchard- the creation of our very-own Apple Orchard, sustainably-grown and harvested apples, where visitors can also pick their own.
• ""Farm2FrontDoor"" Produce Box - fresh, homegrown and locally grown produce delivered right to your doorstep with featured recipes.
• Expanded River Front Walkway with River Access - free access for farm visitors who want to utilize the Tuckaseegee River for recreational activities
• BarnBoard- overnight Barn Inn- a cozy room and board for people to stay at while visiting Darnell Farms.
• Educational Field Trip Cost Shares for local schools and educational groups -- help retain the cost of field trips and souvenirs for local school and educational groups who will visit our farm.

By contributing to our campaign, we adding more things to do, and making Darnell Farms an affordable experience for everyone to make their own. You also help us create more economy right here in Swain County
column2: as we expand we will be able to add more jobs. With just a little support, we can turn Darnell Farms into everyone's ""home away from home"", please contribute to our Agritourism Expansion.

column1: Our farm has the potential to be a reputable and inexpensive  place to bring your friends and family. We want to educate individuals on their beauty of our culture here in the mountains of Western North Carolina, and what better way to do that than through a wonderful Agriculture experience. For the last few years we have exponentially grown our Fall Agritourism Experience, now we want to make our experience more appropriate for the entire farming season. As a reputable farm in this area that has tried to continue keeping agriculture alive in this area, we feel as if we owe it to our visitors to only add more to what they are able to do when visiting our farm, and with your help we can do it!

One of the hardest struggles in this industry is the lack of capital that banks and lending institutions are willing to give to farmers, due to the fact that farmers have very little collateral that the can use when trying to apply for funds. We feel as if this small contribution to our campaign will eventually put us in a position where we can put even more into our local and economy.
Please share this on any social media outlet so that others can help us with our campaign!

• Do you ever have something you want to do, but you don't because you have nobody to do it with?
• Have you recently moved to a new city and don't know anyone?
• Do you find it difficult to meet new people?
• Do you simply want to make new friends?
• Do you want to go on dates, but without the awkwardness of dating apps, knowing when you match that you'll meet that day and know exactly what you'll be doing?
• Do you want to know what your friends are doing today and perhaps join them, without needing to individually contact everyone?
If you answered yes to any of these, Civy can help.

The first version of the beta application is starting to near completion, and a lot of the work now is on design, performance, security, and bug fixing. But there is still a lot of work to do, and you can help us.
• All funds will be spent on the development and promotion of the application and any associated costs such as server and storage costs. Launching the beta version will be the first priority.
• After beta release, more planned features will be added, performance will be improved, discovered bugs will be fixed, security will be enhanced, etc.
• Will integrate blockchain solutions using the Tezos protocol.

In today's world, we have withdrawn from traditional methods of meeting new people. Many won't even make a phone call to order food, everything is preferred via an app. Let's help these people, or anyone else, get out and meet new people. Explore new places, make new friends, or try new activities, all without the awkwardness of approaching random people or using dating applications.

To have value in a particular city, there need to be users. One of the biggest challenges will be expanding to new cities and countries, ensuring that anyone opening the app actually has activities to join or people to match with. We will attempt to solve this by launching in each area, step by step, while focusing marketing and promotion efforts in that specific location. Eventually, after the app gains some fame, we will be more suited to launch globally, everywhere, easily.
Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
• Share the campaign, website, or app details on social media.

The campaign is end. If you missed the crowdfunding please click the button below to purchase on our official site.

High quality, for the masses. This is our goal here at Asiwo, and we inch closer to that goal everyday. Our mission is to serve the people and be a part of the e-transportation movement. We achieve that through controlling every aspect of our production line, from research to design, building and testing, we not only ensure we deliver to the world excellent products, but also something the world needed.
Don't let buoyancy restrain you any longer. With the 2019 Water Scooter, the sea bed is the limit. Experience all the ocean has to offer with up to 30m/100ft of diving!

We bring whole upgraded ASIWO waterproof bag to you. With higher quality, beautiful appearance, best match with Sea Scooter. This product promotion is still suitable for the first 100 backers.
Both the Asiwo Turbo and Asiwo Turbo Pro support single - handed operation, something we
learned from listening to you during our public tests. This new feature gives you the freedom to
move around while having another hand free for other activities.
Easy operations for better use. ASIWO TURBO  SEASCOOTER is designed with 3 gears speed.
1. Press the on-off button simultaneously on both sides of the wing to enable it.
2. Press twice the right wing button for the next up gear (when you need to speed up）
Press twice the left wing button for the previous gear (when you need to speed down). Adjust the gear according to your needs in fast or low water flow.

The Asiwo Turbo Pro increases and optimisms the battery life, giving the Sea Scooter the ability to run for up to 70 minutes. With the same functionality as the standard Sea Scooter, 3 gear speeds and 30m depth, this larger battery capacity unfortunately cannot travel with you on an airplane. That being said, if flying isn’t an issue and you want more time in the water, the Turbo Pro gives you more than double the amount of time in the water then the standard model, that’s 70 minutes of swimming, diving and exploring.

Forget heavy weights and other techniques to get you closer to the action, take the scooter for a trial, with a depth of 30m/100ft see just how easy it is to touch the floor. Or swim along side the fishes with ease with 3 gears of speed, allowing up to 3.5mph.

With the innovative advancements in chip technology, we’ve managed to ensure extremely low power consumption to not only give you longer usage and standby time, but more powerful thrust too. With two 600W motors, one on both sides, you can expect quick startups and fast journeys.

It’s specially designed and tested body ensures a streamlined flow of water around and through the scooter, and your passage. With less resistance also comes less noise.

A built-in GoPro attachment on the front housing means you can capture everything you see while below the surface. It also acts as a safety float for your devices, since the Sea Scooter floats to the surface if you let go, your devices safely reach the top with it.
column2:
/>

Being the most powerful personal water device to hit the market this year, we also had to make it the most portable. At only 21.3cm in length and 52.7cm wide, we designed it to be perfectly shoulders width apart to not only maximise its power, but it’s comfort and portability.

After several tests, followed by several more modifications to the final design, we decided to add a buoyancy chamber to allow the Sea Scooter to naturally float back up to the surface if dropped or out of power.

Safety is important when partaking in water sports, you can’t be distracted or fiddling with gadgets, especially while underwater. We know the importance of safety and have ensured that the operation of the device is as simple as possible, while also including safety measures such as lock mode and a buckle design on the battery to keep it secure.
column4:
/>

We’ve also added useful features like a power display on the backside, so you can view while using the scooter, allowing you to plan accordingly. The charger also allows the ability to charge two batteries at once to save time.
column5:
/>

Weighing in at only 7.7lbs (3.5kg), you can safely pack and bring the Asiwo Water Scooter to any vacation or trip, with no stress of check in or weight limits. It’s also light enough to carry around beaches and swimming pools without breaking a sweat.

Light in weight, small in size, plentiful in components.

We are giving away some of these awesome add-ons forevery suitcase you order. Please check description of eachperk to see what add-ons are included. You can also grab more of these accessaries with discount on the suitcase check out page.

Our battery-powered charger with rechargeable batteries and we offer three different types of chargers (EU, AU, US), depending on your region. This device charges all your batteries. The charger also works with any mains voltage (110, 220).

For more info, please click the links below:

 

About ASIWO

With a team of experienced designers, engineers and sport’s enthusiasts, we are able to deliver products to an exceptional degree. We hold our suppliers to the same standards to safeguard our customers experience and safety. By regularly testing and trying our products, our team is able to prevent any issues from arising at the final stage of production and maintain a safety standard across the board, because that’s what we care about the most.

Press twice the left wing button for the previous gear (when you need to speed down). Adjust the gear according to your needs in fast or low water flow.

The Asiwo Turbo Pro increases and optimisms the battery life, giving the Sea Scooter the ability to run for up to 70 minutes. With the same functionality as the standard Sea Scooter, 3 gear speeds and 30m depth, this larger battery capacity unfortunately cannot travel with you on an airplane. That being said, if flying isn’t an issue and you want more time in the water, the Turbo Pro gives you more than double the amount of time in the water then the standard model, that’s 70 minutes of swimming, diving and exploring.

Forget heavy weights and other techniques to get you closer to the action, take the scooter for a trial, with a depth of 30m/100ft see just how easy it is to touch the floor. Or swim along side the fishes with ease with 3 gears of speed, allowing up to 3.5mph.

With the innovative advancements in chip technology, we’ve managed to ensure extremely low power consumption to not only give you longer usage and standby time, but more powerful thrust too. With two 600W motors, one on both sides, you can expect quick startups and fast journeys.It’s specially designed and tested body ensures a streamlined flow of water around and through the scooter, and your passage. With less resistance also comes less noise.A built-in GoPro attachment on the front housing means you can capture everything you see while below the surface. It also acts as a safety float for your devices, since the Sea Scooter floats to the surface if you let go, your devices safely reach the top with it. Being the most powerful personal water device to hit the market this year, we also had to make it the most portable. At only 21.3cm in length and 52.7cm wide, we designed it to be perfectly shoulders width apart to not only maximise its power, but it’s comfort and portability.After several tests, followed by several more modifications to the final design, we decided to add a buoyancy chamber to allow the Sea Scooter to naturally float back up to the surface if dropped or out of power.Safety is important when partaking in water sports, you can’t be distracted or fiddling with gadgets, especially while underwater. We know the importance of safety and have ensured that the operation of the device is as simple as possible, while also including safety measures such as lock mode and a buckle design on the battery to keep it secure.  We’ve also added useful features like a power display on the backside, so you can view while using the scooter, allowing you to plan accordingly. The charger also allows the ability to charge two batteries at once to save time.Weighing in at only 7.7lbs (3.5kg), you can safely pack and bring the Asiwo Water Scooter to any vacation or trip, with no stress of check in or weight limits. It’s also light enough to carry around beaches and swimming pools without breaking a sweat.Light in weight, small in size, plentiful in components. What does ASIWO TURBO  SEASCOOTER say：

Earn Cash Rewards for SharingJoin Kickbooster and earn cash rewards towards every referral link you share!We are giving away some of these awesome add-ons forevery suitcase you order. Please check description of eachperk to see what add-ons are included. You can also grab more of these accessaries with discount on the suitcase check out page.Our battery-powered charger with rechargeable batteries and we offer three different types of chargers (EU, AU, US), depending on your region. This device charges all your batteries. The charger also works with any mains voltage (110, 220).For more info, please click the links below: About ASIWOWith a team of experienced designers, engineers and sport’s enthusiasts, we are able to deliver products to an exceptional degree. We hold our suppliers to the same standards to safeguard our customers experience and safety. By regularly testing and trying our products, our team is able to prevent any issues from arising at the final stage of production and maintain a safety standard across the board, because that’s what we care about the most.",61.0,6,"1 Campaign

column16:
Crush Your Commute with Ease

The torque sensor pedal assist gives a more natural ride than an electric bike with a throttle. Free up your hands to signal to others around your path, drink from a water bottle and do other small tasks without pausing or slowing down.

You can choose from 5 levels of assistance to how much power you want from the motor, so it always gives you the power that you need. By doing so, you can get a higher range per charge and go farther than if you were relying solely on the battery.

column25:
>

The team behind Spinciti has decades of hands-on experience in the international bicycle industry: design, development, sourcing, and sales.

Spinciti has a presence in San Francisco, Mexico City, The Netherlands, Taiwan, and China.

We have developed our e-bikes with the latest technology in batteries, motors and other components using external design and engineering teams for support.

We have experience developing companies and a strong track record of launching successful bicycle brands into global markets.

Our brand promise is to bring e-mobility solutions to the largest global audience. Spinciti products have an optimal mix of performance, reliability, and affordability. Our ambition is to play a pivotal role in introducing e-mobility.

We measure success by the ability to transform the standards of sustainable living environments and well being.

column3:
>

Customize, store and dispense multiple toiletries like shampoo, body wash, face wash, lotion and conditioner, all from one portable device. GoBout is the world’s first portable multi-dispenser that is completely customizable so that you can go anywhere, anytime.
column4:
>

GoBout makes it easy to pack all the liquids you need in one simple container. It is compact, spill-free, environmentally friendly and perfect for camping, road trips and traveling.
column6:
>

 Pack lite and go anywhere, anytime!
column8:
>

Let’s face it: packing your toiletries is not the smoothest thing on earth. Traveling with separate containers consumes valuable space and the containers often leak. No matter how organized you try to be, keeping track of too many containers can be difficult. Thus, GoBout was invented with two goals: Simplicity and environmental friendly.
column10:
>

Before GoBout, we have been carrying separate travel size bottles, usually inside a plastic bag, for lack of a more suitable, smart and sustainable alternative. Millions of people use plastic containers and plastic bags to transport toiletries every day. Tens of billions of plastic toiletry containers end up in waste landfills every year. This needs to change if we are to save our planet from pollution. GoBout helps solve this crisis by offering a convenient, comprehensive way of reusing travel size bottles. You simply refill your capsules at home and store them in our beautiful housing dispenser.
column11:
>

GoBout comes in two sizes: Large and small.
column12:
>

For the large version, there are five capsules. Each capsule is less than 100ml or 3.4 ounces, which means at some airport security checks, you just have to remove the capsules from the main body.
column13:
>

For the small version, there are four capsules. In total, the small version carries less than 100 ml or 3.4 ounces. You don't need to remove capsules from the main body because it complies with air travel rules.
column15:
>

The biggest challenge in designing GoBout was achieving simplicity. How should the user select different products to dispense? How do we avoid accidental leaks? How to refill empty canisters in the most efficient and environmentally friendly way possible? We researched every conceivable dispensation method: Aerosal, compressed air, vacuum, etc.

In the end, we achieved all of our goals without sacrificing function or form. The final GoBout design is a simple, elegant solution to a real problem.
column16:
>

A simple design means less complexity, better user experience, and less opportunity for malfunction.

column1: Here is a video of our first working prototype.
Here are some of our earliest sketches!

column5:
>

Over the past 7 months, we have been hard at work preparing to bring you the world's best portable multi-dispenser. We truly believe that this is the future of traveling more with less while also helping the environment.
column7:
>

We can't wait for you to be the first to get your hands on the GoBout. Feel free to check out our rewards. Thank you so much for your support, and hey just Go Be Out with GoBout, the world's best portable multi-dispenser.

","Customize, store and dispense multiple toiletries like shampoo, body wash, face wash, lotion and conditioner, all from one portable device. GoBout is the world’s first portable multi-dispenser that is completely customizable so that you can go anywhere, anytime.GoBout makes it easy to pack all the liquids you need in one simple container. It is compact, spill-free, environmentally friendly and perfect for camping, road trips and traveling.   Pack lite and go anywhere, anytime!  Let’s face it: packing your toiletries is not the smoothest thing on earth. Traveling with separate containers consumes valuable space and the containers often leak. No matter how organized you try to be, keeping track of too many containers can be difficult. Thus, GoBout was invented with two goals: Simplicity and environmental friendly. Before GoBout, we have been carrying separate travel size bottles, usually inside a plastic bag, for lack of a more suitable, smart and sustainable alternative. Millions of people use plastic containers and plastic bags to transport toiletries every day. Tens of billions of plastic toiletry containers end up in waste landfills every year. This needs to change if we are to save our planet from pollution. GoBout helps solve this crisis by offering a convenient, comprehensive way of reusing travel size bottles. You simply refill your capsules at home and store them in our beautiful housing dispenser. GoBout comes in two sizes: Large and small. For the large version, there are five capsules. Each capsule is less than 100ml or 3.4 ounces, which means at some airport security checks, you just have to remove the capsules from the main body. For the small version, there are four capsules. In total, the small version carries less than 100 ml or 3.4 ounces. You don't need to remove capsules from the main body because it complies with air travel rules.  The biggest challenge in designing GoBout was achieving simplicity. How should the user select different products to dispense? How do we avoid accidental leaks? How to refill empty canisters in the most efficient and environmentally friendly way possible? We researched every conceivable dispensation method: Aerosal, compressed air, vacuum, etc.In the end, we achieved all of our goals without sacrificing function or form. The final GoBout design is a simple, elegant solution to a real problem. A simple design means less complexity, better user experience, and less opportunity for malfunction.

column1: I am Brian Filko, a mechanical engineer/entrepreneur from Pennsylvania. I have carried many different types of multitools on my keychain over the years and have always been frustrated when tightening and loosening screws.  The constant lifting and repositioning of these tools/bits to only get a quarter turn makes these multitools impractical for most common fixes.

I decided to channel my frustrations by designing a multitool featuring a dynamic ratchet so you don't need to lift and reposition the tool between each turn. This saves you time and allows you to use EverRatchet for small and also large fixes.
We are offering this tool in Stainless Steel or Titanium and are including a #2 Phillips Bit and a custom-sized Flint2Go Fire Flint!
column3: >Thanks to EverRatchet's Dynamic Ratcheting Beam you can turn large fixes into small fixes since you don't need to lift and reset the tool between each turn.
column7: >EverRatchet's dynamic ratcheting beam stays completely rigid when rotating the bit but when resetting the tool it flexes allowing the tool to rotate around the bit.  This amazing ratchet makes this a one size fits all tool for any project and is a much-needed feature when you are working with limited visibility or space.  Let's get ratcheting!
column8: >Watch those bits spin, forever!

column22: >How much force can EverRatchet handle? Shown below is a Stainless Steel EverRatchet holding 20 in-lbs on its dynamic ratchet beam (20lbs, 1 inch from the center of rotation)! Thanks to the ratchet beam design, it is extremely strong down its length but flexes out of the way with some satisfying click action when you go to reset the tool.

column41: >EverRatchet will be cut from a solid sheet of Stainless Steel or Titanium using EDM (Electrical Discharge Manufacturing). This manufacturing method uses a computer controlled machine to pull an electrified wire through the sheet of metal resulting in very precise components.
column44: >A Surface Finish Perfected Over Time.
column45: >We have improved our products surface finishes over the past year to make them more and more scratch resistant.  EverRatchet will be featuring our latest glass and polymer applied finish to keep it nice and new every time you reach for it.

Whether you're a Pro, Weekend Warrior or Cycling Commuter, We know that you want and deserve the finest and safest taillight
• Aerodynamic fitting seat rail, by a custom designed mount.
• Equipped with an advanced triaxial accelerate sensor to accurately trigger a stop light when breaking.
• Integrated light sensor auto-adjusts brightness to your environment
• 180 degree field of view, with visibility up to 1km
<li>Smart On/Off movement detection, LUCIA turns itself off if no movement is detected &amp
column2: turns instantly on when you start pedaling..

column1: • With an illuminance sensor to automatically turn on when a cyclist rides on dark roads.
• Waterproof: IPX4 to cycle under all weather conditions
• USB rechargeable Li-Ion battery offers up to 24hr of run time in eco mode

Designed to be SEEN

The all-new LUCIA is Compact, Powerful, Lightweight, Discreet and Features focused Lumens optics to provide meaningful visibility to drivers from up to 1km.
column8: s=d8db0314f5e8d9176ad121eff5cbd0d8"" src=""""/>
column10: >LUCIA is compatible with any type of bike saddle with rails
column11: >Whether it is made of carbon, aluminum or iron. LUCIA can be used with any type of bicycle: Road, MTB, Urban.
column14: >Light up your backside and make you fully visible from behind
column21:
s=8efb628ebaabca437e5fa3723d290c15"" src=""""/>

 

The LUCIA main purpose above all is to produce about as much light as an automotive rear light.
column35:
s=73b32fea4f70da0f73e6c1fc5d71e778"" src=""""/>

 

With night detection sensor to automatically switch on dark roads.
column42:
s=910c64d47b558f9875e0046f16aee357"" src=""""/>

 

With an illuminance sensor
column49:
s=c711b401bcc6a1e0b6d700966cf6afee"" src=""""/>

 

The standard measure of the brightness of a light is the number of lumens, however, make no mistake about the fact that the more lumens there are, the better. Lumens are an important part of a light, but even a 60-watt bulb that can produce 800 lumens. If you take this bulb and move away, it won't look very bright, whereas if you have a really focused laser, it may only produce one lumen, but you can see it from miles away.
column56:
s=63cf3bcb9b26608e887622db16981dd6"" src=""""/> 

 

LUCIA LEDs use optics to concentrate that beam angle and increase its brightness. Drivers have a lot of distraction going on, if you have a steady light, it blends in with the surroundings where is if you’ve got a flashing light, it sticks out and really catches people’s attention.

 

WATERPROOF |  Don't let the weather stop you |  Be the bigger distraction.
column64:
manufactured in South Korea 

 

Prototyping

We have spent endless hours designing, developing, and improving LUCIA ever since the first sketch.  We are quality addicts. We use a high-end electronics manufacturer based in South Korea. Each item is meticulously tested multiple times before moving to the next component.

column1: Aerodynamic fitting seat rail, by a custom designed mount.
Equipped with an advanced triaxial accelerate sensor to accurately trigger a stop light when breaking.
Integrated light sensor auto-adjusts brightness to your environment
180 degree field of view, with visibility up to 1km
Smart On/Off movement detection, LUCIA turns itself off if no movement is detected & turns instantly on when you start pedaling..
With an illuminance sensor to automatically turn on when a cyclist rides on dark roads.
Waterproof: IPX4 to cycle under all weather conditions
USB rechargeable Li-Ion battery offers up to 24hr of run time in eco mode

Designed to be SEENThe all-new LUCIA is Compact, Powerful, Lightweight, Discreet and Features focused Lumens optics to provide meaningful visibility to drivers from up to 1km.    LUCIA is compatible with any type of bike saddle with railsWhether it is made of carbon, aluminum or iron. LUCIA can be used with any type of bicycle: Road, MTB, Urban. Light up your backside and make you fully visible from behind  The LUCIA main purpose above all is to produce about as much light as an automotive rear light.    With night detection sensor to automatically switch on dark roads.  With an illuminance sensor The standard measure of the brightness of a light is the number of lumens, however, make no mistake about the fact that the more lumens there are, the better. Lumens are an important part of a light, but even a 60-watt bulb that can produce 800 lumens. If you take this bulb and move away, it won't look very bright, whereas if you have a really focused laser, it may only produce one lumen, but you can see it from miles away.   LUCIA LEDs use optics to concentrate that beam angle and increase its brightness. Drivers have a lot of distraction going on, if you have a steady light, it blends in with the surroundings where is if you’ve got a flashing light, it sticks out and really catches people’s attention. WATERPROOF |  Don't let the weather stop you |  Be the bigger distraction. Conceptualized in France & manufactured in South Korea  PrototypingWe have spent endless hours designing, developing, and improving LUCIA ever since the first sketch.  We are quality addicts. We use a high-end electronics manufacturer based in South Korea. Each item is meticulously tested multiple times before moving to the next component.  ModesInterruptive flash pattern increases Lumens brightness for ultimate daytime visibility        Join THE BEAM for our 3rd Indiegogo campaign. In May 2017 We launched our 1st Indiegogo with CORKY - Rear-view Cycling Mirror since then, thousands of bikes worldwide have been equipped with our products and THE BEAM our company, has gained international recognition for Designing Safety. THE BEAM has been rewarded with a prestigious Red Dot Award. Beginning 2019 We successfully launched our 2nd Kickstarter  WHEEL & FRAME FLASH Hi-Vis Bike reflectors.The success of our first two campaigns, in 2017 | 2019, laid a strong foundation for our company and since then we have manufactured and shipped over 25,000 cycling products to customers across 110+ countries. For this new Tail light Design, we have identified and locked top manufacturers & export companies who will be able to ship within 15 days of successful project funding, so you can enjoy your own LUCIA during the winter.We know perfectly what we are doing, WE HAVE BECAME TRUE PROFESSIONALS thanks to the experience, the quality of all our products and all the feedback we have received from our customers around the world. Click on theses links If you want to know more about the FREE products we're offering with your LUCIA:   CORKY - Unlikely Rear-view Cycling Mirror  On Indiegogo /  Kickstarter 2017WHEEL & FRAME FLASH Hi-Vis Bike reflectors On Kickstarter 2019WE PROMISE THAT YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR TAILLIGHT LONG BEFORE CHRISTMAS.Risques et défisWe know perfectly what we are doing, WE HAVE BECAME TRUE PROFESSIONALS thanks to the experience, the quality of all our products and all the feedback we have received from our customers around the world.We currently have a functional prototype of LUCIA that is ready for mass production. However, we are aware that there may be necessary changes to meet manufacturing requirements.",42.0,0,"3 Campaigns
